VkMemoryAllocateInfo.summary: Structure containing parameters of a memory allocation.
VkMemoryAllocateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkMemoryAllocateInfo.AllocationSize.summ: The size of the allocation in bytes.
VkMemoryAllocateInfo.MemoryTypeIndex.sum: An index identifying a memory type from the MemoryTypes array of the <see cref="VkPhysicalDeviceMemoryProperties"/> structure.
VkMemoryRequirements.Size.summary: The size, in <see langword="byte"/>s, of the memory allocation required for the resource.
VkMemoryRequirements.Alignment.summary: The alignment, in <see langword="byte"/>s, of the offset within the allocation required for the resource.
VkMemoryRequirements.MemoryTypeBits.summ: Contains one bit set for every supported memory type for the resource. Bit i is set if and only if the memory type i in the <see cref="VkPhysicalDeviceMemoryProperties"/> structure for the physical device is supported for the resource.
VkSparseImageFormatProperties.summary: Structure specifying sparse image format properties.
VkSparseImageFormatProperties.AspectMask: A bitmask <see cref="VkImageAspectFlags"/> specifying which aspects of the image the properties apply to.
VkSparseImageFormatProperties.ImageGranu: The width, height, and depth of the sparse image block in texels or compressed texel blocks.
VkSparseImageFormatProperties.Flags.summ: A bitmask of <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatFlags "/> specifying additional information about the sparse resource.
VkSparseImageMemoryRequirements.summary: Structure specifying sparse image memory requirements.
VkSparseImageMemoryRequirements.FormatPr: A <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatProperties"/> structure specifying properties of the image format.
VkSparseImageMemoryRequirements.ImageMip: The first mip level at which image subresources are included in the mip tail region.

The memory size (in <see langword="byte"/>s) of the mip tail region. If <see cref="FormatProperties"/>.Flags contains <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatFlags.SingleMiptail"/>, this is the size of the whole mip tail, otherwise this is the size of the mip tail of a single array layer. This value is guaranteed to be a multiple of the sparse block size in <see langword="byte"/>s.
The opaque memory offset used with <see cref="VkSparseImageOpaqueMemoryBindInfo"/> to bind the mip tail region(s).

The offset stride between each array-layer’s mip tail, if <see cref="FormatProperties"/>.Flags does not contain <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatFlags.SingleMiptail"/> (otherwise the value is undefined).
VkMemoryType.PropertyFlags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkMemoryPropertyFlags"/> of properties for this memory type.
VkMemoryType.HeapIndex.summary: Describes which memory heap this memory type corresponds to, and must be less than <see cref="VkPhysicalDeviceMemoryProperties.MemoryHeapCount"/>.
VkMemoryHeap.Size.summary: The total memory size in <see langword="byte"/>s in the heap.
VkMemoryHeap.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkMemoryHeapFlags"/> specifying attribute flags for the heap.
VkMappedMemoryRange.summary: Structure specifying a mapped memory range.
VkMappedMemoryRange.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkMappedMemoryRange.Memory.summary: The memory object to which this range belongs.
VkMappedMemoryRange.Offset.summary: The zero-based <see langword="byte"/> offset from the beginning of the memory object.
VkMappedMemoryRange.Size.summary: Either the size of range, or <see cref="VK.WholeSize"/> to affect the range from offset to the end of the current mapping of the allocation.
A bitmask of <see cref="VkFormatFeatureFlags"/> specifying features supported by images created with a tiling parameter of <see cref="VkImageTiling.Linear"/>.
VkFormatProperties.OptimalTilingFeatures: A bitmask of <see cref="VkFormatFeatureFlags"/> specifying features supported by images created with a tiling parameter of <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>.
VkFormatProperties.BufferFeatures.summar: A bitmask of <see cref="VkFormatFeatureFlags"/> specifying features supported by buffers.
VkImageFormatProperties.summary: Structure specifying an image format properties.
VkImageFormatProperties.MaxMipLevels.sum: The maximum number of mipmap levels.
VkImageFormatProperties.MaxArrayLayers.s: The maximum number of array layers.
VkImageFormatProperties.SampleCounts.sum: A bitmask of <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> specifying all the supported sample counts for this image.
An upper bound on the total image size in <see langword="byte"/>s, inclusive of all image subresources.
VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Offset.summary: The offset in <see langword="byte"/>s from the start of buffer. Access to buffer memory via this descriptor uses addressing that is relative to this starting offset.
VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Range.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s that is used for this descriptor update, or <see cref="VK.WholeSize"/> to use the range from <see cref="Offset"/> to the end of the buffer.
VkDescriptorImageInfo.Sampler.summary: A sampler handle that is used in descriptor updates for types <see cref="VkDescriptorType.Sampler"/> and <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSampler"/> if the binding being updated does not use immutable samplers.
VkDescriptorImageInfo.ImageView.summary: <see cref="VkImageView.Null"/> or an image view handle, and is used in descriptor updates for types <see cref="VkDescriptorType.SampledImage"/>, <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageImage"/>, <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSmapler"/>, and <see cref="VkDescriptorType.ImputAttachment"/>.
VkDescriptorImageInfo.ImageLayout.summar: The layout that the image subresources accessible from <see cref="ImageView"/> will be in at the time this descriptor is accessed. <see cref="ImageLayout"/> is used in descriptor updates for types <see cref="VkDescriptorType.SampledImage"/>, <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageImage"/>, <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSmapler"/>, and <see cref="VkDescriptorType.ImputAttachment"/>.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of a descriptor set write operation.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.DestinationSet.summ: The destination descriptor set to update.
The descriptor binding within that set.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.DestinationArrayEle: The starting element in that array. If the descriptor binding identified by <see cref="DestinationSet"/> and <see cref="DestinationBinding"/> has a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.InlineUniformBlock"> then <see cref="DestinationArrayElement"/> specifies the starting <see langword="byte"/> offset within the binding.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.DescriptorCount.sum: The number of descriptors to update. If the descriptor binding identified by <see cref="DestinationSet"/> and <see cref="DestinationBinding"/> has a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.InlineUniformBlock">, then <see cref="DescriptorCount"/> specifies the number of <see langword="byte"/>s to update.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.DescriptorType.summ: A <see cref="VkDescriptorType"> specifying the type of each descriptor in <see cref="ImageInfo"/>, <see cref="BufferInfo"/>, or <see cref="TexelBufferView"/>.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.ImageInfo.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorImageInfo"/> structures or is ignored.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.BufferInfo.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo"/> structures or is ignored.
VkWriteDescriptorSet.TexelBufferView.sum: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkBufferView"/> handles or is ignored.
VkCopyDescriptorSet.summary: Structure specifying a copy descriptor set operation.
VkCopyDescriptorSet.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkCopyDescriptorSet.DescriptorCount.summ: The number of descriptors to copy from the source to destinatio
VkBufferCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of a newly created buffer object.
VkBufferCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkBufferCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkBufferCreateFlags"/> specifying additional parameters of the buffer.
VkBufferCreateInfo.Size.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the buffer to be created.
VkBufferCreateInfo.Usage.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkBufferUsageFlags"/> specifying allowed usages of the buffer.
VkBufferCreateInfo.SharingMode.summary: A <see cref="VkSharingMode"/> value specifying the sharing mode of the buffer when it will be accessed by multiple queue families.
VkBufferCreateInfo.QueueFamilyIndexCount: The number of entries in the <see cref="QueueFamilyIndices"/> array.
VkBufferCreateInfo.QueueFamilyIndices.su: A pointer to an array of queue families that will access this buffer. It is ignored if <see cref="SharingMode"/> is not <see cref="VkSharingMode.Concurrent"/>.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created buffer view.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Buffer.summary: A <see cref="VkBuffer"/> on which the view will be created.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Format.summary: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> describing the format of the data elements in the buffer.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Offset.summary: An offset in <see langword="byte"/>s from the base address of the buffer. Accesses to the buffer view from shaders use addressing that is relative to this starting offset.
VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Range.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the buffer view. If range is equal to <see cref="VK.WholeSize"/>, the range from offset to the end of the buffer is used. If <see cref="VK.WholeSize"/> is used and the remaining size of the buffer is not a multiple of the texel block size of <see cref="Format"/>, the nearest smaller multiple is used.
VkImageSubresource.AspectMask.summary: A <see cref="VkImageAspectFlags"/> value selecting the image aspect.
VkImageSubresourceLayers.summary: Structure specifying an image subresource layers.
VkImageSubresourceLayers.AspectMask.summ: A combination of <see cref="VkImageAspectFlags"/>, selecting the color, depth and/or stencil aspects to be copied.
VkImageSubresourceLayers.LayerCount.summ: The number of layers to copy.
VkImageSubresourceRange.summary: Structure specifying an image subresource range.
VkImageSubresourceRange.AspectMask.summa: A bitmask of <see cref="VkImageAspectFlags"/> specifying which aspect(s) of the image are included in the view.
VkImageSubresourceRange.BaseMipLevel.sum: The first mipmap level accessible to the view.
VkImageSubresourceRange.LevelCount.summa: The number of mipmap levels (starting from <see cref="BaseMipLevel"/>) accessible to the view.
VkImageSubresourceRange.BaseArrayLayer.s: The first array layer accessible to the view.
VkImageSubresourceRange.LayerCount.summa: The number of array layers (starting from <see cref="BaseArrayLayer"/>) accessible to the view.
VkMemoryBarrier.summary: Structure specifying a global memory barrier.
VkMemoryBarrier.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkMemoryBarrier.SourceAccessMask.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a source access mask.
VkMemoryBarrier.DestinationAccessMask.su: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a destination access mask.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.summary: Structure specifying a buffer memory barrier.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.SourceAccessMask.s: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a source access mask.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.DestinationAccessM: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a destination access mask.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.SourceQueueFamilyI: The source queue family for a queue family ownership transfer.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.DestinationQueueFa: The destination queue family for a queue family ownership transfer.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.Buffer.summary: A handle to the buffer whose backing memory is affected by the barrier.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.Offset.summary: An offset in <see langword="byte"/>s into the backing memory for <see cref="Buffer"/>; this is relative to the base offset as bound to the buffer.
VkBufferMemoryBarrier.Size.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the affected area of backing memory for <see cref="Buffer"/>, or <see cref="VK.WholeSize"/> to use the range from <see cref="Offset"/> to the end of the buffer.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of an image memory barrier.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.SourceAccessMask.su: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a source access mask.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.DestinationAccessMa: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a destination access mask.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.OldLayout.summary: The old layout in an image layout transition.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.NewLayout.summary: The new layout in an image layout transition.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.SourceQueueFamilyIn: The source queue family for a queue family ownership transfer.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.DestinationQueueFam: The destination queue family for a queue family ownership transfer.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.Image.summary: A handle to the image affected by this barrier.
VkImageMemoryBarrier.SubresourceRange.su: The image subresource range within image that is affected by this barrier.
VkImageCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of a newly created image object.
VkImageCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkImageCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags"/> describing additional parameters of the image.
VkImageCreateInfo.ImageType.summary: A <see cref="VkImageType"/> value specifying the basic dimensionality of the image. Layers in array textures do not count as a dimension for the purposes of the image type.
VkImageCreateInfo.Format.summary: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> describing the format and type of the texel blocks that will be contained in the image.
VkImageCreateInfo.Extent.summary: A <see cref="VkExtent3D"/> describing the number of data elements in each dimension of the base level.
VkImageCreateInfo.MipLevels.summary: he number of levels of detail available for minified sampling of the image.
VkImageCreateInfo.ArrayLayers.summary: The number of layers in the image.
VkImageCreateInfo.Samples.summary: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> value specifying the number of samples per texel.
VkImageCreateInfo.Tiling.summary: A <see cref="VkImageTiling"/> value specifying the tiling arrangement of the texel blocks in memory.
VkImageCreateInfo.Usage.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags"/> describing the intended usage of the image.
VkImageCreateInfo.SharingMode.summary: A <see cref="VkSharingMode"/> value specifying the sharing mode of the image when it will be accessed by multiple queue families.
The number of entries in the <see cref="QueueFamilyIndices"/> array.
VkImageCreateInfo.QueueFamilyIndices.sum: A pointer to an array of queue families that will access this image. It is ignored if <see cref="SharingMode"/> is not <see cref="VkSharingMode.Concurrent"/>.
VkImageCreateInfo.InitialLayout.summary: A <see cref="VkImageLayout"/> value specifying the initial <see cref="VkImageLayout"/> of all image subresources of the image.
VkSubresourceLayout.Offset.summary: The <see langword="byte"/> offset from the start of the image or the plane where the image subresource begins.
VkSubresourceLayout.Size.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the image subresource. <see cref="Size"/> includes any extra memory that is required based on <see cref="RowPitch"/>.
VkSubresourceLayout.RowPitch.summary: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s between each row of texels in an image.
VkSubresourceLayout.ArrayPitch.summary: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s between each array layer of an image.
VkSubresourceLayout.DepthPitch.summary: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s between each slice of 3D image.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created image view.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkImageViewCreateFlags"/> describing additional parameters of the image view.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.Image.summary: A <see cref="VkImage"/> on which the view will be created.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.ViewType.summary: A <see cref="VkImageViewType"/> value specifying the type of the image view.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.Format.summary: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> describing the format and type used to interpret texel blocks in the image.
VkImageViewCreateInfo.Components.summary: A <see cref="VkComponentMapping"/> structure specifying a remapping of color components (or of depth or stencil components after they have been converted into color components).
VkImageViewCreateInfo.SubresourceRange.s: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceRange"/> structure selecting the set of mipmap levels and array layers to be accessible to the view.
VkBufferCopy.summary: Structure specifying a buffer copy operation.
VkBufferCopy.SourceOffset.summary: The starting offset in <see langword="byte"/>s from the start of SourceBuffer.
VkBufferCopy.DestinationOffset.summary: The starting offset in <see langword="byte"/>s from the start of DestinationBuffer.
VkBufferCopy.Size.summary: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s to copy.
VkSparseMemoryBind.summary: Structure specifying a sparse memory bind operation.
VkSparseMemoryBind.Size.summary: The size of the memory region to be bound.
VkSparseMemoryBind.Memory.summary: The <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> object that the range of the resource is bound to. If <see cref="Memory"/> is <see cref="VkDeviceMemory.Null"/>, the range is unbound.
VkSparseMemoryBind.MemoryOffset.summary: The offset into the <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> object to bind the resource range to. If <see cref="Memory"/> is <see cref="VkDeviceMemory.Null"/>, this value is ignored.
VkSparseMemoryBind.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkSparseMemoryBindFlags"/> specifying usage of the binding operation.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.summary: Structure specifying sparse image memory bind.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.Subresource.summ: The image aspect and region of interest in the image.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.Offset.summary: The coordinates of the first texel within the image subresource to bind.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.Extent.summary: The size in texels of the region within the image subresource to bind. The extent must be a multiple of the sparse image block dimensions, except when binding sparse image blocks along the edge of an image subresource it can instead be such that any coordinate of <see cref="Offset"/> + <see cref="Extent"/> equals the corresponding dimensions of the image subresource.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.Memory.summary: The <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> object that the sparse image blocks of the image are bound to. If <see cref="Memory"/> is <see cref="VkDeviceMemory.Null"/>, the sparse image blocks are unbound.
VkSparseImageMemoryBind.MemoryOffset.sum: An offset into <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> object. If <see cref="Memory"/> is <see cref="VkDeviceMemory.Null"/>, this value is ignored.
VkSparseBufferMemoryBindInfo.summary: Structure specifying a sparse buffer memory bind operation.
VkSparseBufferMemoryBindInfo.Buffer.summ: The <see cref="VkBuffer"/> object to be bound.
VkSparseBufferMemoryBindInfo.BindCount.s: The number of <see cref="VkSparseMemoryBind"/> structures in the <see cref="Binds"/> array.
VkSparseBufferMemoryBindInfo.Binds.summa: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseMemoryBind"/> structures.
VkSparseImageOpaqueMemoryBindInfo.summar: Structure specifying sparse image opaque memory bind information.
The <see cref="VkImage"/> object to be bound.
VkSparseImageOpaqueMemoryBindInfo.BindCo: The number of <see cref="VkSparseMemoryBind"/> structures in the <see cref="Binds"/> array.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseMemoryBind"/> structures.
VkSparseImageMemoryBindInfo.summary: Structure specifying sparse image memory bind information.
VkSparseImageMemoryBindInfo.Image.summar: The <see cref="VkImage"/> object to be bound
VkSparseImageMemoryBindInfo.BindCount.su: The number of <see cref="VkSparseImageMemoryBind"/> structures in <see cref="Binds"/> array
VkSparseImageMemoryBindInfo.Binds.summar: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseImageMemoryBind "/> structures
VkBindSparseInfo.summary: Structure specifying a sparse binding operation.
VkBindSparseInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkBindSparseInfo.WaitSemaphoreCount.summ: The number of semaphores upon which to wait before executing the sparse binding operations for the batch.
VkBindSparseInfo.WaitSemaphores.summary: A pointer to an array of semaphores upon which to wait on before the sparse binding operations for this batch begin execution.
VkBindSparseInfo.BufferBindCount.summary: The number of sparse buffer bindings to perform in the batch.
VkBindSparseInfo.BufferBinds.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseBufferMemoryBindInfo"/> structures.
VkBindSparseInfo.ImageOpaqueBindCount.su: The number of opaque sparse image bindings to perform.
VkBindSparseInfo.ImageOpaqueBinds.summar: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseImageOpaqueMemoryBindInfo"/> structures, indicating opaque sparse image bindings to perform.
VkBindSparseInfo.ImageBindCount.summary: The number of sparse image bindings to perform.
VkBindSparseInfo.ImageBinds.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSparseImageMemoryBindInfo"/> structures, indicating sparse image bindings to perform.
VkBindSparseInfo.SignalSemaphoreCount.su: The number of semaphores to be signaled once the sparse binding operations specified by the structure have completed execution.
VkBindSparseInfo.SignalSemaphores.summar: A pointer to an array of semaphores which will be signaled when the sparse binding operations for this batch have completed execution.
VkImageCopy.summary: Structure specifying an image copy operation.
VkImageCopy.SourceSubresource.summary: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceLayers"/> structure specifying the image subresources of the images used for the source image data.
VkImageCopy.SourceOffset.summary: The initial x, y, and z offsets in texels of the sub-regions of the source image data.
VkImageCopy.DestinationSubresource.summa: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceLayers"/> structure specifying the image subresources of the images used for the destination image data.
VkImageCopy.DestinationOffset.summary: The initial x, y, and z offsets in texels of the sub-regions of the destination image data.
VkImageCopy.Extent.summary: The size in texels of the image to copy in width, height and depth.
VkImageBlit.summary: Structure specifying an image blit operation.
VkImageBlit.SourceOffsets0.summary: The 1st <see cref="VkOffset3D"/> structure specifying the bounds of the source region within <see cref="SourceSubresource"/>.
VkImageBlit.SourceOffsets1.summary: The 2nd <see cref="VkOffset3D"/> structure specifying the bounds of the source region within <see cref="SourceSubresource"/>.
VkImageBlit.DestinationOffsets0.summary: The 1st <see cref="VkOffset3D"/> structure specifying the bounds of the destination region within <see cref="DestinationSubresource"/>.
VkImageBlit.DestinationOffsets1.summary: The 2nd <see cref="VkOffset3D"/> structure specifying the bounds of the destination region within <see cref="DestinationSubresource"/>.
VkBufferImageCopy.summary: Structure specifying a buffer image copy operation.
VkBufferImageCopy.BufferOffset.summary: The offset in <see langword="byte"/>s from the start of the buffer object where the image data is copied from or to.
VkBufferImageCopy.BufferRowLength.summar: Specify in texels a subregion of a larger two- or three-dimensional image in buffer memory, and control the addressing calculations.
VkBufferImageCopy.BufferImageHeight.summ: Specify in texels a subregion of a larger two- or three-dimensional image in buffer memory, and control the addressing calculations.
VkBufferImageCopy.ImageSubresource.summa: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceLayers"/> used to specify the specific image subresources of the image used for the source or destination image data.
VkBufferImageCopy.ImageOffset.summary: The initial x, y, z offsets in texels of the sub-region of the source or destination image data.
VkBufferImageCopy.ImageExtent.summary: The size in texels of the image to copy in width, height and depth.
VkImageResolve.summary: Structure specifying an image resolve operation.
VkImageResolve.SourceSubresource.summary: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceLayers"/> structures specifying the image subresources of the images used for the source image data.
VkImageResolve.SourceOffset.summary: The initial x, y, and z offsets in texels of the sub-regions of the source image data.
VkImageResolve.DestinationSubresource.su: A <see cref="VkImageSubresourceLayers"/> structures specifying the image subresources of the images used for the destination image data.
VkImageResolve.DestinationOffset.summary: The initial x, y, and z offsets in texels of the sub-regions of the destination image data.
VkImageResolve.Extent.summary: The size in texels of the source image to resolve in width, height and depth.
VkShaderModuleCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created shader module.
VkShaderModuleCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkShaderModuleCreateInfo.CodeSize.summar: The size, in <see langword="byte"/>s, of the code pointed to by <see cref="Code"/>.
VkShaderModuleCreateInfo.Code.summary: A pointer to code that is used to create the shader module. The type and format of the code is determined from the content of the memory addressed by <see cref="Code"/>.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding.summary: Structure specifying a descriptor set layout binding.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding.Binding.sum: The binding number of this entry and corresponds to a resource of the same binding number in the shader stages.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding.DescriptorT: A <see cref="VkDescriptorType"/> specifying which type of resource descriptors are used for this binding.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding.DescriptorC: The number of descriptors contained in the binding, accessed in a shader as an array, except if <see cref="DescriptorType"> is <see cref="VkDescriptorType.InlineUniformBlock"/> in which case <see cref="DescriptorCount"> is the size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the inline uniform block. If <see cref="DescriptorCount"> is zero this binding entry is reserved and the resource must not be accessed from any stage via this binding within any pipeline using the set layout.
A bitmask of <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags"/> specifying which pipeline shader stages can access a resource for this binding. <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags.All"/> is a shorthand specifying that all defined shader stages, including any additional stages defined by extensions, can access the resource.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding.ImmutableSa: <see cref="ImmutableSamplers"/> affects initialization of samplers. If <see cref="DescriptorType"/> specifies a <see cref="VkDescriptorType.Sampler"/> or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSampler"/> type descriptor, then <see cref="ImmutableSamplers"/> can be used to initialize a set of immutable samplers. Immutable samplers are permanently bound into the set layout and must not be changed; updating a <see cref="VkDescriptorType.Sampler"/> descriptor with immutable samplers is not allowed and updates to a <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSampler"/> descriptor with immutable samplers does not modify the samplers (the image views are updated, but the sampler updates are ignored).
VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created descriptor set layout.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateInfo.Next.sum: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateInfo.Flags.su: A bitmask of <see cref="VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateFlags"/> specifying options for descriptor set layout creation.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateInfo.BindingC: The number of elements in <see cref="Bindings"/>.
VkDescriptorSetLayoutCreateInfo.Bindings: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorSetLayoutBinding"/> structures.
VkDescriptorPoolSize.DescriptorCount.sum: The number of descriptors of that type to allocate. If <see cref="Type"/> is <see cref="VkDescriptorType.InlineUniformBlock"/> then <see cref="DescriptorCount"/> is the number of <see langword="byte"/>s to allocate for descriptors of this type.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created descriptor pool.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkDescriptorPoolCreateFlags"/> specifying certain supported operations on the pool.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.MaxSets.summa: The maximum number of descriptor sets that can be allocated from the pool.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.PoolSizeCount: The number of elements in <see cref="PoolSizes"/>.
VkDescriptorPoolCreateInfo.PoolSizes.sum: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorPoolSize"/> structures, each containing a descriptor type and number of descriptors of that type to be allocated in the pool.
VkDescriptorSetAllocateInfo.summary: Structure specifying the allocation parameters for descriptor sets.
VkDescriptorSetAllocateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDescriptorSetAllocateInfo.DescriptorPo: The pool which the sets will be allocated from.
VkDescriptorSetAllocateInfo.DescriptorSe: The number of descriptor sets to be allocated from the pool.
VkDescriptorSetAllocateInfo.SetLayouts.s: A pointer to an array of descriptor set layouts, with each member specifying how the corresponding descriptor set is allocated.
VkSpecializationMapEntry.summary: Structure specifying a specialization map entry.
VkSpecializationMapEntry.ConstantID.summ: The ID of the specialization constant in SPIR-V.
VkSpecializationMapEntry.Offset.summary: The <see langword="byte"/> offset of the specialization constant value within the supplied data buffer.
VkSpecializationMapEntry.Size.summary: The <see langword="byte"/> size of the specialization constant value within the supplied data buffer.
VkSpecializationInfo.MapEntryCount.summa: The number of entries in the <see cref="MapEntries"/> array.
VkSpecializationInfo.MapEntries.summary: a pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSpecializationMapEntry"/> structures which map constant IDs to offsets in <see cref="Data"/>.
VkSpecializationInfo.DataSize.summary: The <see langword="byte"/> size of the <see cref="Data"/> buffer.
VkSpecializationInfo.Data.summary: The actual constant values to specialize with.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline shader stage.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Next.sum: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Flags.su: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineShaderStageCreateFlags"/> specifying how the pipeline shader stage will be generated.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Stage.su: A <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags"/> value specifying a single pipeline stage.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Module.s: A <see cref="VkShaderModule"/> object containing the shader code for this stage.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Name.sum: A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string specifying the entry point name of the shader for this stage.
VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo.Speciali: A pointer to a <see cref="VkSpecializationInfo"/> structure or <see langword="null"/>.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created compute pipeline.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.Flags.summar: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineCreateFlags"/> specifying how the pipeline will be generated.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.Stage.summar: A <see cref="VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo"/> structure describing the compute shader.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.Layout.summa: The description of binding locations used by both the pipeline and descriptor sets used with the pipeline.
VkComputePipelineCreateInfo.BasePipeline: An index into the <see cref="CreateInfos"/> parameter to use as a pipeline to derive from.
VkVertexInputBindingDescription.summary: Structure specifying vertex input binding description.
The binding number that this structure describes.
VkVertexInputBindingDescription.Stride.s: The <see langword="byte"/> stride between consecutive elements within the buffer.
VkVertexInputBindingDescription.InputRat: A <see cref="VkVertexInputRate"/> value specifying whether vertex attribute addressing is a function of the vertex index or of the instance index.
VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.summar: Structure specifying vertex input attribute description.
VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.Locati: The shader input location number for this attribute.
VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.Bindin: The binding number which this attribute takes its data from.
VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.Format: The size and type of the vertex attribute data.
VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.Offset: A <see langword="byte"/> offset of this attribute relative to the start of an element in the vertex input binding.
VkPipelineVertexInputStateCreateInfo.sum: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline vertex input state.
VkPipelineVertexInputStateCreateInfo.Nex: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineVertexInputStateCreateInfo.Ver: The number of vertex binding descriptions provided in <see cref="VertexBindingDescriptions">.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkVertexInputBindingDescription"/> structures.
The number of vertex attribute descriptions provided in <see cref="VertexAttributeDescriptions"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkVertexInputAttributeDescription"/> structures.
VkPipelineInputAssemblyStateCreateInfo.s: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline input assembly state.
VkPipelineInputAssemblyStateCreateInfo.N: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineInputAssemblyStateCreateInfo.T: A <see cref="VkPrimitiveTopology"/> defining the primitive topology.
VkPipelineInputAssemblyStateCreateInfo.P: Whether a special vertex index value is treated as restarting the assembly of primitives.
VkPipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo.su: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline tessellation state.
VkPipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo.Ne: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo.Pa: The number of control points per patch.
VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.summar: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline viewport state.
VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.Next.s: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.Viewpo: The number of viewports used by the pipeline.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkViewport"/> structures, defining the viewport transforms. If the viewport state is dynamic, this member is ignored.
VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.Scisso: The number of scissors, must match the number of viewports.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkRect2D"/> structures defining the rectangular bounds of the scissor for the corresponding viewport. If the scissor state is dynamic, this member is ignored.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.s: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline rasterization state.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.N: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.D: Whether to clamp the fragment’s depth values.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.R: Whether primitives are discarded immediately before the rasterization stage.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.C: The triangle facing direction used for primitive culling.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.F: A <see cref="VkFrontFace"/> value specifying the front-facing triangle orientation to be used for culling.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.D: Whether to bias fragment depth values.
A scalar factor controlling the constant depth value added to each fragment.
The maximum (or minimum) depth bias of a fragment.
A scalar factor applied to a fragment’s slope in depth bias calculations.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.L: The width of rasterized line segments.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.sum: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline multisample state.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Nex: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Ras: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> value specifying the number of samples used in rasterization.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Sam: can be used to enable sample shading.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Min: A minimum fraction of sample shading if <see cref="SampleShadingEnable"/> is set to <see cref="VK.True"/>.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Sam: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSampleMask"/> values used in the sample mask test.
VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.Alp: Whether a temporary coverage value is generated based on the alpha component of the fragment’s first color output.
Whether the alpha component of the fragment’s first color output is replaced with one.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.summ: Structure specifying a pipeline color blend attachment state.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Blen: Whether blending is enabled for the corresponding color attachment. If blending is not enabled, the source fragment’s color for that attachment is passed through unmodified.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Sour: Selects which blend factor is used to determine the source factors (Sr,Sg,Sb).
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Dest: Selects which blend factor is used to determine the destination factors (Dr,Dg,Db).
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Colo: Selects which blend operation is used to calculate the RGB values to write to the color attachment.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Sour: Selects which blend factor is used to determine the source factor Sa.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Dest: Selects which blend factor is used to determine the destination factor Da.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Alph: Selects which blend operation is used to calculate the alpha values to write to the color attachment.
VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState.Colo: A bitmask of <see cref="VkColorComponentFlags"/> specifying which of the R, G, B, and/or A components are enabled for writing.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.summ: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline color blend state.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.Next: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.Flag: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateFlags"/> specifying additional color blending information.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.Logi: Selects which logical operation to apply.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.Atta: The number of <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState"/> elements in <see cref="Attachments"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState"/> structures defining blend state for each color attachment.
VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.Blen: A pointer to an array of four values used as the R, G, B, and A components of the blend constant that are used in blending, depending on the blend factor.
VkPipelineDynamicStateCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline dynamic state.
VkPipelineDynamicStateCreateInfo.Next.su: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineDynamicStateCreateInfo.Dynamic: The number of elements in the <see cref="DynamicStates"/> array.

A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDynamicState"/> values specifying which pieces of pipeline state will use the values from dynamic state commands rather than from pipeline state creation information.
VkStencilOpState.FailOp.summary: A <see cref="VkStencilOp"> value specifying the action performed on samples that fail the stencil test.
VkStencilOpState.PassOp.summary: A <see cref="VkStencilOp"/> value specifying the action performed on samples that pass both the depth and stencil tests.
VkStencilOpState.DepthFailOp.summary: A <see cref="VkStencilOp"/> value specifying the action performed on samples that pass the stencil test and fail the depth test.
VkStencilOpState.CompareOp.summary: A <see cref="VkCompareOp"/> value specifying the comparison operator used in the stencil test.
VkStencilOpState.CompareMask.summary: The bits of the unsigned integer stencil values participating in the stencil test.
VkStencilOpState.WriteMask.summary: The bits of the unsigned integer stencil values updated by the stencil test in the stencil framebuffer attachment.
VkStencilOpState.Reference.summary: An integer stencil reference value that is used in the unsigned stencil comparison.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.su: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline depth stencil state.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Ne: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Fl: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateFlags"/> specifying additional depth/stencil state information.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.De: Whether depth writes are enabled when <see cref="DepthTestEnable"/> is <see cref="VK.True"/>. Depth writes are always disabled when <see cref="DepthTestEnable"/> is <see cref="VK.False"/>.
A <see cref="VkCompareOp"/> value specifying the comparison operator to use in the depth comparison step of the depth test.
Whether depth bounds testing is enabled.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Fr: The front parameter of the stencil test.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Ba: The back parameter of the stencil test.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Mi: The minimum depth bound used in the depth bounds test.
VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.Ma: The maximum depth bound used in the depth bounds test.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created graphics pipeline.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Next.summar: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Flags.summa: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineCreateFlags"/> specifying how the pipeline will be generated.
The number of entries in the <see cref="Stages"/> array.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Stages.summ: A pointer to an array of <see cref="StageCount"/> <see cref="VkPipelineShaderStageCreateInfo"/> structures describing the set of the shader stages to be included in the graphics pipeline.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.VertexInput: A pointer to a <see c ref="VkPipelineVertexInputStateCreateInfo"/> structure. It is ignored if the pipeline includes a mesh shader stage.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.InputAssemb: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineInputAssemblyStateCreateInfo"/> structure which determines input assembly behavior. It is ignored if the pipeline includes a mesh shader stage.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Tessellatio: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining tessellation state used by tessellation shaders.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.ViewportSta: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining viewport state used when rasterization is enabled.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Rasterizati: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining rasterization state.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Multisample: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining multisample state used when rasterization is enabled.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.DepthStenci: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining depth/stencil state used when rasterization is enabled for depth or stencil attachments accessed during rendering.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.ColorBlendS: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining color blend state used when rasterization is enabled for any color attachments accessed during rendering.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.DynamicStat: A pointer to a <see cref="VkPipelineDynamicStateCreateInfo"/> structure defining which properties of the pipeline state object are dynamic and can be changed independently of the pipeline state. This can be <see langword="null"/>, which means no state in the pipeline is considered dynamic.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Layout.summ: The description of binding locations used by both the pipeline and descriptor sets used with the pipeline.
A handle to a render pass object describing the environment in which the pipeline will be used. The pipeline must only be used with a render pass instance compatible with the one provided.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.Subpass.sum: The index of the subpass in the render pass where this pipeline will be used.
VkGraphicsPipelineCreateInfo.BasePipelin: An index into the <see cref="CreateInfos"/> parameter to use as a pipeline to derive from.
VkPipelineCacheCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created pipeline cache.
VkPipelineCacheCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineCacheCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineCacheCreateFlags"/> specifying the behavior of the pipeline cache.
VkPipelineCacheCreateInfo.InitialDataSiz: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s in <see cref="InitialData"/>. If <see cref="InitialDataSize"/> is zero, the pipeline cache will initially be empty.
VkPipelineCacheCreateInfo.InitialData.su: A pointer to previously retrieved pipeline cache data. If the pipeline cache data is incompatible with the device, the pipeline cache will be initially empty. If <see cref="InitialDataSize"/> is zero, <see cref="InitialData"/> is ignored.
VkPipelineCacheHeaderVersionOne.summary: Structure describing the layout of the pipeline cache header.
VkPipelineCacheHeaderVersionOne.HeaderSi: The length in <see langword="byte"/>s of the pipeline cache header.
VkPipelineCacheHeaderVersionOne.HeaderVe: A <see cref="VkPipelineCacheHeaderVersion"/> enum value specifying the version of the header. A consumer of the pipeline cache should use the cache version to interpret the remainder of the cache header.
VkPushConstantRange.summary: Structure specifying a push constant range.
VkPushConstantRange.StageFlags.summary: a set of stage flags describing the shader stages that will access a range of push constants. If a particular stage is not included in the range, then accessing members of that range of push constants from the corresponding shader stage will return undefined values.
VkPushConstantRange.Offset.summary: The <see langword="byte"/> offset of the push constant, this must be a multiple of 4.
VkPushConstantRange.Size.summary: The size in <see langword="byte"/>s of the push constant, this must be a multiple of 4.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying the parameters of a newly created pipeline layout object.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineLayoutCreateFlagBits"/> specifying options for pipeline layout creation.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.SetLayoutCoun: The number of descriptor sets included in the pipeline layout.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.SetLayouts.su: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorSetLayout"/> objects.
VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.PushConstantR: The number of push constant ranges included in the pipeline layout.

A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkPushConstantRange"/> structures defining a set of push constant ranges for use in a single pipeline layout. In addition to descriptor set layouts, a pipeline layout also describes how many push constants can be accessed by each stage of the pipeline.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created sampler.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkSamplerCreateFlags"/> describing additional parameters of the sampler.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MagFilter.summary: A <see cref="VkFilter"/> value specifying the magnification filter to apply to lookups.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MinFilter.summary: A <see cref="VkFilter"/> value specifying the minification filter to apply to lookups.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MipmapMode.summary: A <see cref="VkSamplerMipmapMode"/> value specifying the mipmap filter to apply to lookups.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.AddressModeU.summary: A <see cref="VkSamplerAddressMode"/> value specifying the addressing mode for U coordinates outside [0,1].
VkSamplerCreateInfo.AddressModeV.summary: A <see cref="VkSamplerAddressMode"/> value specifying the addressing mode for V coordinates outside [0,1].
VkSamplerCreateInfo.AddressModeW.summary: A <see cref="VkSamplerAddressMode"/> value specifying the addressing mode for W coordinates outside [0,1].
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MipLodBias.summary: The bias to be added to mipmap LOD (level-of-detail) calculation and bias provided by image sampling functions in SPIR-V.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MaxAnisotropy.summar: The anisotropy value clamp used by the sampler when <see cref="AnisotropyEnable"/> is <see cref="VK.True"/>. If <see cref="AnisotropyEnable"/> is <see cref="VK.False"/>, <see cref="MaxAnisotropy"/> is ignored.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.CompareEnable.summar: Whether to enable comparison against a reference value during lookups.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.CompareOp.summary: A <see cref="VkCompareOp"/> value specifying the comparison operator to apply to fetched data before filtering.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MinLod.summary: Used to clamp the minimum of the computed LOD value.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.MaxLod.summary: Used to clamp the maximum of the computed LOD value. To avoid clamping the maximum value, set <see cref="MaxLod"/> to the constant <see cref="VK.LodClampNone"/>.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.BorderColor.summary: A <see cref="VkBorderColor"/> value specifying the predefined border color to use.
VkSamplerCreateInfo.UnnormalizedCoordina: Whether to use unnormalized or normalized texel coordinates to address texels of the image. When set to <see cref="VK.True"/>, the range of the image coordinates used to lookup the texel is in the range of zero to the image size in each dimension. When set to <see cref="VK.False"/> the range of image coordinates is zero to one.
VkCommandPoolCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created command pool.
VkCommandPoolCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkCommandPoolCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkCommandPoolCreateFlags"/> indicating usage behavior for the pool and command buffers allocated from it.
VkCommandPoolCreateInfo.QueueFamilyIndex: The queue family that any command buffer allocated from the pool will be submitted to.
VkCommandBufferAllocateInfo.summary: Structure specifying the allocation parameters for command buffer object.
VkCommandBufferAllocateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
The command pool from which the command buffers are allocated.
VkCommandBufferAllocateInfo.Level.summar: A <see cref="VkCommandBufferLevel"/> value specifying the command buffer level.
VkCommandBufferAllocateInfo.CommandBuffe: The number of command buffers to allocate from the pool.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.summary: Structure specifying command buffer inheritance information.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.Next.summ: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.RenderPas: A <see cref="VkRenderPass"/> object defining which render passes the <see cref="VkCommandBuffer"/> will be compatible with and can be executed within.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.Subpass.s: The index of the subpass within the render pass instance that the <see cref="VkCommandBuffer"/> will be executed within.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.Framebuff: The <see cref="VkFramebuffer"/> object that the <see cref="VkCommandBuffer"/> will be rendering to if it is executed within a render pass instance. It can be <see cref="VkFramebuffer.Null"/> if the framebuffer is not known.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.Occlusion: Whether the command buffer can be executed while an occlusion query is active in the primary command buffer.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.QueryFlag: The query flags that can be used by an active occlusion query in the primary command buffer when this secondary command buffer is executed.
VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo.PipelineS: A bitmask of <see cref="VkQueryPipelineStatisticFlags"/> specifying the set of pipeline statistics that can be counted by an active query in the primary command buffer when this secondary command buffer is executed.
VkCommandBufferBeginInfo.summary: Structure specifying a command buffer begin operation.
VkCommandBufferBeginInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkCommandBufferBeginInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkCommandBufferUsageFlags"/> specifying usage behavior for the command buffer.
VkCommandBufferBeginInfo.InheritanceInfo: A pointer to a <see cref="VkCommandBufferInheritanceInfo"/> structure, used if <see cref="CommandBuffer"/> is a secondary command buffer. If this is a primary command buffer, then this value is ignored.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.summary: Structure specifying render pass begin information.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.RenderPass.summary: The render pass to begin an instance of.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.Framebuffer.summar: The framebuffer containing the attachments that are used with the render pass.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.RenderArea.summary: The render area that is affected by the render pass instance, and is described in more detail below.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.ClearValueCount.su: The number of elements in <see cref="ClearValues"/>.
VkRenderPassBeginInfo.ClearValues.summar: A pointer to an array of <see cref="ClearValueCount"/> <see cref="VkClearValue"/> structures containing clear values for each attachment.
VkClearColorValue.summary: Structure specifying a clear color value.
VkClearColorValue.Float32.summary: The color clear values when the format of the image or attachment is one of the formats other than signed integer or unsigned integer.
VkClearColorValue.Int32.summary: The color clear values when the format of the image or attachment is signed integer.
VkClearColorValue.Uint32.summary: The color clear values when the format of the image or attachment is unsigned integer.
VkClearDepthStencilValue.summary: Structure specifying a clear depth stencil value.
VkClearDepthStencilValue.Depth.summary: The clear value for the depth aspect of the depth/stencil attachment. It is a floating-point value which is automatically converted to the attachment’s format.
VkClearDepthStencilValue.Stencil.summary: The clear value for the stencil aspect of the depth/stencil attachment. It is a 32-bit integer value which is converted to the attachment’s format by taking the appropriate number of LSBs.
VkClearValue.Color.summary: The color image clear values to use when clearing a color image or attachment.
VkClearValue.DepthStencil.summary: The depth and stencil clear values to use when clearing a depth/stencil image or attachment.
VkClearAttachment.AspectMask.summary: A mask selecting the color, depth and/or stencil aspects of the attachment to be cleared.
VkClearAttachment.ColorAttachment.summar: The index into the currently bound color attachments, if <see cref="AspectMask"/> is <see cref="VkImageAspectFlags.Color"/>.
VkClearAttachment.ClearValue.summary: The color or depth/stencil value to clear the attachment to.
VkAttachmentDescription.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAttachmentDescriptionFlags"/> specifying additional properties of the attachment.
VkAttachmentDescription.Format.summary: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> value specifying the format of the image view that will be used for the attachment.
VkAttachmentDescription.Samples.summary: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> value specifying the number of samples of the image.
VkAttachmentDescription.LoadOp.summary: A <see cref="VkAttachmentLoadOp"/> value specifying how the contents of color and depth components of the attachment are treated at the beginning of the subpass where it is first used.
VkAttachmentDescription.StoreOp.summary: A <see cref="VkAttachmentStoreOp"/> value specifying how the contents of color and depth components of the attachment are treated at the end of the subpass where it is last used.
VkAttachmentDescription.StencilLoadOp.su: A <see cref="VkAttachmentLoadOp"/> value specifying how the contents of stencil components of the attachment are treated at the beginning of the subpass where it is first used.
VkAttachmentDescription.StencilStoreOp.s: A <see cref="VkAttachmentStoreOp"/> value specifying how the contents of stencil components of the attachment are treated at the end of the last subpass where it is used.
VkAttachmentDescription.InitialLayout.su: The layout the attachment image subresource will be in when a render pass instance begins.
VkAttachmentDescription.FinalLayout.summ: The layout the attachment image subresource will be transitioned to when a render pass instance ends.
VkAttachmentReference.Attachment.summary: An integer value identifying an attachment at the corresponding index in <see cref="VkRenderPassCreateInfo.Attachments"/>, or <see cref="VK.AttachmentUnused"/> to signify that this attachment is not used.
VkAttachmentReference.Layout.summary: A <see cref="VkImageLayout"/> value specifying the layout the attachment uses during the subpass.
VkSubpassDescription.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkSubpassDescriptionFlags"/> specifying usage of the subpass.
VkSubpassDescription.PipelineBindPoint.s: A <see cref="VkPipelineBindPoint"/> value specifying the pipeline type supported for this subpass.
VkSubpassDescription.InputAttachments.su: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkAttachmentReference"/> structures defining the input attachments for this subpass and their layouts.
VkSubpassDescription.ColorAttachments.su: A pointer to an array of <see cref="ColorAttachmentCount"/> <see cref="VkAttachmentReference"/> structures defining the color attachments for this subpass and their layouts.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to an array of <see cref="ColorAttachmentCount"/> <see cref="VkAttachmentReference"/> structures defining the resolve attachments for this subpass and their layouts.
VkSubpassDescription.DepthStencilAttachm: A pointer to a <see cref="VkAttachmentReference"/> structure specifying the depth/stencil attachment for this subpass and its layout.
VkSubpassDescription.PreserveAttachments: A pointer to an array of <see cref="PreserveAttachmentCount"/> render pass attachment indices identifying attachments that are not used by this subpass, but whose contents must be preserved throughout the subpass.
VkSubpassDependency.SourceSubpass.summar: The subpass index of the first subpass in the dependency, or <see cref="VK.SubpassExternal"/>.
VkSubpassDependency.DestinationSubpass.s: The subpass index of the second subpass in the dependency, or <see cref="VK.SubpassExternal"/>.
VkSubpassDependency.SourceStageMask.summ: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineStageFlags"/> specifying the source stage mask.
VkSubpassDependency.DestinationStageMask: A bitmask of <see cref="VkPipelineStageFlags"/> specifying the destination stage mask
VkSubpassDependency.SourceAccessMask.sum: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a source access mask.
VkSubpassDependency.DestinationAccessMas: A bitmask of <see cref="VkAccessFlags"/> specifying a destination access mask.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created render pass.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.AttachmentCount.s: The number of attachments used by this render pass.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.Attachments.summa: A pointer to an array of <see cref="AttachmentCount"/> <see cref="VkAttachmentDescription"/> structures describing the attachments used by the render pass.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.SubpassCount.summ: The number of subpasses to create.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.Subpasses.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="SubpassCount"/> <see cref="VkSubpassDescription"/> structures describing each subpass.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.DependencyCount.s: The number of memory dependencies between pairs of subpasses.
VkRenderPassCreateInfo.Dependencies.summ: A pointer to an array of <see cref="DependencyCount"/> <see cref="VkSubpassDependency"/> structures describing dependencies between pairs of subpasses.
VkEventCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created event.
VkEventCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkEventCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkEventCreateFlags"/> defining additional creation parameters.
VkFenceCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created fence.
VkFenceCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkFenceCreateInfo.Flags.summary: A bitmask of <see cref="VkFenceCreateFlags"/> specifying the initial state and behavior of the fence.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.summary: Structure describing the fine-grained features that can be supported by an implementation.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.RobustBufferAcc: Specifies that accesses to buffers are bounds-checked against the range of the buffer descriptor (as determined by <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Range"/>, <see cref="VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Range"/>, or the size of the buffer).
Out of bounds accesses must not cause application termination, and the effects of shader loads, stores, and atomics must conform to an implementation-dependent behavior.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.FullDrawIndexUi: Specifies the full 32-bit range of indices is supported for indexed draw calls when using <see cref="VkIndexType.Uint32"/>.
Specifies whether image views with <see cref="VkImageViewType.CubeArray"/> can be created, and that the corresponding <c>SampledCubeArray</c> and <c>ImageCubeArray</c> SPIR-V capabilities can be used in shader code.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.IndependentBlen: Specifies whether the <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState"/> settings are controlled independently per-attachment.

If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState"/> settings for all color attachments must be identical. Otherwise, a different <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendAttachmentState"/> can be provided for each bound color attachment.
Specifies whether geometry shaders are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags.Geometry"/> and <see cref="VkPipelineStageFlags.GeometryShader"/> enum values must not be used. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>Geometry</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.TessellationSha: Specifies whether tessellation control and evaluation shaders are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags.TessellationControl"/>, <see cref="VkShaderStageFlags.TessellationEvaluation"/>, <see cref="VkPipelineStageFlags.TessellationControlShader"/>, <see cref="VkPipelineStageFlags.TessellationEvaluationShader"/>, and <see cref="VkStructureType.PipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo"/> enum values must not be used. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>Tessellation</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.SampleRateShadi: Specifies whether sample shading and multisample interpolation are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.SampleShadingEnable"/> must be set to <see cref="VK.False"/> and <see cref="VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.MinSampleShading"/> is ignored. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>SampleRateShading</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DualSourceBlend: Specifies whether blend operations which take two sources are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkBlendFactor.Source1Color"/>, <see cref="VkBlendFactor.OneMinusSource1Color"/>, <see cref="VkBlendFactor.Source1Alpha"/>, and <see cref="VkBlendFactor.OneMinusSource1Alpha"/> enum values must not be used as source or destination blending factors.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.LogicOp.summary: Specifies whether logic operations are supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.LogicOp.remarks: If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.LogicOpEnable"/> must be set to <see cref="VK.False"/>, and <see cref="VkPipelineColorBlendStateCreateInfo.LogicOp"/> is ignored.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.MultiDrawIndire: Specifies whether multiple draw indirect is supported.

If this feature is not enabled, the <c>drawCount</c> parameter to the <see cref="VK.CommandDrawIndirect"/> and <see cref="VK.CommandDrawIndexedIndirect"/> commands must be 0 or 1. <see cref="VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDrawIndirectCount"/> must also be 1 if this feature is not supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DrawIndirectFir: Specifies whether indirect drawing calls support the <c>firstInstance</c> parameter.

If this feature is not enabled, the <c>firstInstance</c> member of all <see cref="VkDrawIndirectCommand"/> and <see cref="VkDrawIndexedIndirectCommand"/> structures that are provided to the <see cref="VK.CommandDrawIndirect"/> and <see cref="VK.CommandDrawIndexedIndirect"/> commands must be 0.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DepthClamp.summ: Specifies whether depth clamping is supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DepthClamp.rema: If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.DepthClampEnable"/> must be set to <see cref="VK.False"/>.
Specifies whether depth bias clamping is supported.

If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.DepthBiasClamp"/> must be set to 0 unless the <see cref="VkDynamicState.DepthBias"/> dynamic state is enabled, and the <c>depthBiasClamp</c> parameter to <see cref="VK.CommandSetDepthBias"/> must be set to 0.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.FillModeNonSoli: Specifies whether point and wireframe fill modes are supported.
If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkPolygonMode.Point"/> and <see cref="VkPolygonMode.Line"/> enum values must not be used.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DepthBounds.sum: Specifies whether depth bounds tests are supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.DepthBounds.rem: If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.DepthBoundsTestEnable"/> must be set to <see cref="VK.False"/>. When <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.DepthBoundsTestEnable"/> is set to <see cref="VK.False"/>, <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.MinDepthBounds"/> and <see cref="VkPipelineDepthStencilStateCreateInfo.MaxDepthBounds"/> are ignored.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.WideLines.summa: Specifies whether lines with width other than 1 are supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.WideLines.remar: If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.LineWidth"/> must be set to 1 unless the <see cref="VkDynamicState.LineWidth"/> dynamic state is enabled, and the <c>lineWidth</c> parameter to <see cref="VK.CommandSetLineWidth"/> must be set to 1.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.LargePoints.sum: Specifies whether points with size greater than 1 are supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.LargePoints.rem: If this feature is not enabled, only a point size of 1 written by a shader is supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.AlphaToOne.summ: Specifies whether the implementation is able to replace the alpha value of the fragment shader color output in the multisample coverage fragment operation.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.AlphaToOne.rema: If this feature is not enabled, then <see cref="VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.AlphaToOneEnable"/> must be set to <see cref="VK.False"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.MultiViewport.s: Specifies whether more than one viewport is supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.MultiViewport.r: If this feature is not enabled:<list type="bullet"><item><see cref="VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.ViewportCount"/> and <see cref="VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.ScissorCount"/> must be set to 1.</item><item>The <c>firstViewport</c> and <c>viewportCount</c> parameters of <see cref="VK.CommandSetViewport"/> must be set to 0 and 1, respectively.</item><item>The <c>firstScissor</c> and <c>scissorCount</c> parameters of <see cref="VK.CommandSetScissor"/> must be set to 0 and 1, respectively.</item><item><see cref="VkPipelineViewportExclusiveScissorStateCreateInfoNV.ExclusiveScissorCount"/> must be set to 0 or 1.</item><item>The <c>firstExclusiveScissor</c> and <c>exclusiveScissorCount</c> parameters of <see cref="VK.CommandSetExclusiveScissorNV"/> must be set to 0 and 1, respectively.</item></list>
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.SamplerAnisotro: Specifies whether anisotropic filtering is supported.
If this feature is not enabled, <see cref="VkSamplerCreateInfo.AnisotropyEnable"/> must be <see cref="VK.False"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.TextureCompress: Specifies whether all of the ETC2 and EAC compressed texture formats are supported.

If this feature is enabled, then the , and features must be supported in for the following formats:












To query for additional properties, or if the feature is not enabled, and can be used to check for supported properties of individual formats as normal.
Specifies whether all of the ASTC LDR compressed texture formats are supported.

If this feature is enabled, then the , and features must be supported in for the following formats:






























To query for additional properties, or if the feature is not enabled, and can be used to check for supported properties of individual formats as normal.
Specifies whether all of the BC compressed texture formats are supported.

If this feature is enabled, then the , and features must be supported in for the following formats:


















To query for additional properties, or if the feature is not enabled, and can be used to check for supported properties of individual formats as normal.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.OcclusionQueryP: Specifies whether occlusion queries returning actual sample counts are supported. Occlusion queries are created in a <see cref="VkQueryPool"/> by specifying a <see cref="VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.QueryType"/> of <see cref="VkQueryType.Occlusion"/> which is passed to <see cref="VK.CreateQueryPool"/>. If this feature is enabled, queries of this type can enable <see cref="VkQueryControlFlags.Precise"/> in the <c>flags</c> parameter to <see cref="VK.CommandBeginQuery"/>.

If this feature is not supported, the implementation supports only boolean occlusion queries. When any samples are passed, boolean queries will return a non-zero result value, otherwise a result value of zero is returned. When this feature is enabled and <see cref="VkQueryControlFlags.Precise"/> is set, occlusion queries will report the actual number of samples passed.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.PipelineStatist: Specifies whether the pipeline statistics queries are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, queries of type <see cref="VkQueryType.PipelineStatistics"/> cannot be created, and none of the <see cref="VkQueryPipelineStatisticFlags"/> bits can be set in the <c>pipelineStatistics</c> member of the <see cref="VkQueryPoolCreateInfo"/> structure.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.VertexPipelineS: Specifies whether storage buffers and images support stores and atomic operations in the vertex, tessellation, and geometry shader stages.

If this feature is not enabled, all storage image, storage texel buffer, and storage buffer variables used by these stages in shader modules must be decorated with the <c>NonWritable</c> decoration (or the <c>readonly</c> memory qualifier in GLSL).
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.FragmentStoresA: Specifies whether storage buffers and images support stores and atomic operations in the fragment shader stage.

If this feature is not enabled, all storage image, storage texel buffer, and storage buffer variables used by the fragment stage in shader modules must be decorated with the <c>NonWritable</c> decoration (or the <c>readonly</c> memory qualifier in GLSL).
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderTessellat: Specifies whether the <c>PointSize</c> built-in decoration is available in the tessellation control, tessellation evaluation, and geometry shader stages.

If this feature is not enabled, members decorated with the <c>PointSize</c> built-in decoration must not be read from or written to and all points written from a tessellation or geometry shader will have a size of 1. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>TessellationPointSize</c> capability for tessellation control and evaluation shaders, or if the shader modules can declare the <c>GeometryPointSize</c> capability for geometry shaders. An implementation supporting this feature must also support one or both of the <c>tessellationShader</c> or <c>geometryShader</c> features.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderImageGath: Specifies whether the extended set of image gather instructions are available in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, the <c>OpImage*Gather</c> instructions do not support the <c>Offset</c> and <c>ConstOffsets</c> operands. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>ImageGatherExtended</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderStorageIm: Specifies whether all the “storage image extended formats” below are supported.

If this feature is supported, then the must be supported in for the following formats:

























Note: feature only adds a guarantee of format support, which is specified for the whole physical device. Therefore enabling or disabling the feature via has no practical effect.
To query for additional properties, or if the feature is not supported, and can be used to check for supported properties of individual formats, as usual rules allow.
