Specifies whether multisampled storage images are supported.

If this feature is not enabled, images that are created with a <c>usage</c> that includes <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Storage"/> must be created with <c>samples</c> equal to <see cref="VkSampleCount.Count1"/>. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>StorageImageMultisample</c> and <c>ImageMSArray</c> capabilities.

Specifies whether storage images require a format qualifier to be specified when reading. <see cref="ShaderStorageImageReadWithoutFormat"/> applies only to formats listed in the storage without format list.

Specifies whether storage images require a format qualifier to be specified when writing. <see cref="ShaderStorageImageWriteWithoutFormat"/> applies only to formats listed in the storage without format list.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderUniformBu: Specifies whether arrays of uniform buffers can be indexed by dynamically uniform integer expressions in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, resources with a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.UniformBuffer"/> or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.UniformBufferDynamic"/> must be indexed only by constant integral expressions when aggregated into arrays in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>UniformBufferArrayDynamicIndexing</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderSampledIm: Specifies whether arrays of samplers or sampled images can be indexed by dynamically uniform integer expressions in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, resources with a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.Sampler"/>, <see cref="VkDescriptorType.CombinedImageSampler"/>, or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.SampledImage"/> must be indexed only by constant integral expressions when aggregated into arrays in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>SampledImageArrayDynamicIndexing</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderStorageBu: Specifies whether arrays of storage buffers can be indexed by dynamically uniform integer expressions in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, resources with a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageBuffer"/> or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageBufferDynamic"/> must be indexed only by constant integral expressions when aggregated into arrays in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>StorageBufferArrayDynamicIndexing</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderStorageIm: Specifies whether arrays of storage images can be indexed by dynamically uniform integer expressions in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, resources with a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageImage"/> must be indexed only by constant integral expressions when aggregated into arrays in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>StorageImageArrayDynamicIndexing</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderClipDista: Specifies whether clip distances are supported in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, any members decorated with the <c>ClipDistance</c> built-in decoration must not be read from or written to in shader modules. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>ClipDistance</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderCullDista: Specifies whether cull distances are supported in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, any members decorated with the <c>CullDistance</c> built-in decoration must not be read from or written to in shader modules. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>CullDistance</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderFloat64.s: Specifies whether 64-bit floats (doubles) are supported in shader code.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderFloat64.r: If this feature is not enabled, 64-bit floating-point types must not be used in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>Float64</c> capability. Declaring and using 64-bit floats is enabled for all storage classes that SPIR-V allows with the <c>Float64</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderInt64.sum: Specifies whether 64-bit integers (signed and unsigned) are supported in shader code.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderInt64.rem: If this feature is not enabled, 64-bit integer types must not be used in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>Int64</c> capability. Declaring and using 64-bit integers is enabled for all storage classes that SPIR-V allows with the <c>Int64</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderInt16.sum: Specifies whether 16-bit integers (signed and unsigned) are supported in shader code.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderInt16.rem: If this feature is not enabled, 16-bit integer types must not be used in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>Int16</c> capability. However, this only enables a subset of the storage classes that SPIR-V allows for the <c>Int16</c> SPIR-V capability: Declaring and using 16-bit integers in the <c>Private</c>, <c>Workgroup</c> (for non-Block variables), and <c>Function</c> storage classes is enabled, while declaring them in the interface storage classes (e.g., <c>UniformConstant</c>, <c>Uniform</c>, <c>StorageBuffer</c>, <c>Input</c>, <c>Output</c>, and <c>PushConstant</c>) is not enabled.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderResourceR: Specifies whether image operations that return resource residency information are supported in shader code.

If this feature is not enabled, the <c>OpImageSparse*</c> instructions must not be used in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>SparseResidency</c> capability. The feature requires at least one of the <c>sparseResidency*</c> features to be supported.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.ShaderResourceM: Specifies whether image operations specifying the minimum resource LOD are supported in shader code.
If this feature is not enabled, the <c>MinLod</c> image operand must not be used in shader code. This also specifies whether shader modules can declare the <c>MinLod</c> capability.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.SparseBinding.s: Specifies whether resource memory can be managed at opaque sparse block level instead of at the object level.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.SparseBinding.r: If this feature is not enabled, resource memory must be bound only on a per-object basis using the <see cref="VK.BindBufferMemory"/> and <see cref="VK.BindImageMemory"/> commands. In this case, buffers and images must not be created with <see cref="VkBufferCreateFlags.SparseBinding"/> and <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseBinding"/> set in <see cref="VkBufferCreateInfo.Flags"/> and <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>, respectively.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.SparseResidency: Specifies whether the device can access partially resident buffers.
If this feature is not enabled, buffers must not be created with <see cref="VkBufferCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkBufferCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the device can access partially resident 2D images with 1 sample per pixel.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2D"/> and samples set to <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags.Count1"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the device can access partially resident 3D images.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._3D"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the physical device can access partially resident 2D images with 2 samples per pixel.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2D"/> and samples set to <see cref="VKSampleCountFlags.Count2"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the physical device can access partially resident 2D images with 4 samples per pixel.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2D"/> and samples set to <see cref="VKSampleCountFlags.Count4"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the physical device can access partially resident 2D images with 8 samples per pixel.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2D"/> and samples set to <see cref="VKSampleCountFlags.Count8"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the physical device can access partially resident 2D images with 16 samples per pixel.

If this feature is not enabled, images with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2D"/> and samples set to <see cref="VKSampleCountFlags.Count2"/> must not be created with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseResidency"/> set in <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>.
Specifies whether the physical device can correctly access data aliased into multiple locations.

If this feature is not enabled, the <see cref="VkBufferCreateFlags.SparseAliased"/> and <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.SparseAliased"/> enum values must not be used in <see cref="VkBufferCreateInfo.Flags"/> and <see cref="VkImageCreateInfo.Flags"/>, respectively.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.VariableMultisa: Specifies whether all pipelines that will be bound to a command buffer during a subpass which uses no attachments must have the same value for <see cref="VkPipelineMultisampleStateCreateInfo.RasterizationSamples"/>.

If set to <see cref="VK.True"/>, the implementation supports variable multisample rates in a subpass which uses no attachments. If set to <see cref="VK.False"/>, then all pipelines bound in such a subpass must have the same multisample rate. This has no effect in situations where a subpass uses any attachments.
VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.InheritedQuerie: Specifies whether a secondary command buffer may be executed while a query is active.
VkPhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.summary: Structure specifying physical device sparse memory properties.
VkPhysicalDeviceSparseProperties.Residen: <see cref="VK.True"/> if the physical device will access all single-sample 2D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format), as described in the Standard Sparse Image Block Shapes (Single Sample) table.

If this property is not supported the value returned in <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatProperties.ImageGranularity"/> for single-sample 2D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.

<see cref="VK.True"/> if the physical device will access all multisample 2D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format), as described in the Standard Sparse Image Block Shapes (MSAA) table.

If this property is not supported, the value returned in <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatProperties.ImageGranularity"/> for multisample 2D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.

<see cref="VK.True"/> if the physical device will access all 3D sparse resources using the standard sparse image block shapes (based on image format), as described in the Standard Sparse Image Block Shapes (Single Sample) table.

If this property is not supported, the value returned in <see cref="VkSparseImageFormatProperties.ImageGranularity"/> for 3D images is not required to match the standard sparse image block dimensions listed in the table.
<see cref="VK.True"/> if images with mip level dimensions that are not integer multiples of the corresponding dimensions of the sparse image block may be placed in the mip tail.

If this property is not reported, only mip levels with dimensions smaller than will be placed in the mip tail.
If this property is reported the implementation is allowed to return in , indicating that mip level dimensions that are not integer multiples of the corresponding dimensions of the sparse image block will be placed in the mip tail.
Whether the physical device can consistently access non-resident regions of a resource.

If this property is <see cref="VK.True"/>, access to non-resident regions of resources will be guaranteed to return values as if the resource was populated with 0; writes to non-resident regions will be discarded.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.summary: Structure reporting implementation-dependent physical device limits.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageDimension: The largest dimension (<c>width</c>) that is guaranteed to be supported for all images created with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._1d"/>.
Some combinations of image parameters (format, usage, etc.) may allow support for larger dimensions, which can be queried using <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties"/>.

The largest dimension (<c>width</c> or <c>height</c>) that is guaranteed to be supported for all images created with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2d"/> and without <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.CubeCompatible"/> set in <c>flags</c>.
Some combinations of image parameters (format, usage, etc.) may allow support for larger dimensions, which can be queried using <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties"/>.
The largest dimension (<c>width</c>, <c>height</c>, or <c>depth</c>) that is guaranteed to be supported for all images created with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._3d"/>.
Some combinations of image parameters (format, usage, etc.) may allow support for larger dimensions, which can be queried using <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties"/>.

The largest dimension (<c>width</c> or <c>height</c>) that is guaranteed to be supported for all images created with an <c>imageType</c> of <see cref="VkImageType._2d"/> and with <see cref="VkImageCreateFlags.CubeCompatible"/> set in <c>flags</c>.
Some combinations of image parameters (format, usage, etc.) may allow support for larger dimensions, which can be queried using <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxImageArrayLaye: The maximum number of layers (<c>arrayLayers</c>) for an image.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelBufferEle: The maximum number of addressable texels for a buffer view created on a buffer which was created with <see cref="VkBufferUsageFlags.UniformTexelBuffer"/> or <see cref="VkBufferUsageFlags.StorageTexelBuffer"/> set in <see cref="VkBufferCreateInfo.Usage"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxUniformBufferR: The maximum value that can be specified in <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Range"/> passed to <see cref="VK.UpdateDescriptorSets"/> for descriptors of type <see cref="VkDescriptorType.UniformBuffer"/> or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.UniformBufferDynamic"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxStorageBufferR: The maximum value that can be specified in <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Range"/> passed to <see cref="VK.UpdateDescriptorSets"/> for descriptors of type <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageBuffer"/> or <see cref="VkDescriptorType.StorageBufferDynamic"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPushConstantsS: The maximum size, in <see langword="byte"/>s, of the pool of push constant memory.
For each of the push constant ranges indicated by <see cref="VkPipelineLayoutCreateInfo.PushConstantRanges"/>, (<c>offset</c> + <c>size</c>) must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxMemoryAllocati: The maximum number of device memory allocations, as created by <see cref="VK.AllocateMemory"/>, which can simultaneously exist.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerAllocat: The maximum number of sampler objects, as created by <see cref="VK.CreateSampler"/>, which can simultaneously exist on a device.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.BufferImageGranul: The granularity, in <see langword="byte"/>s, at which buffer or linear image resources, and optimal image resources can be bound to adjacent offsets in the same <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> object without aliasing.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SparseAddressSpac: The total amount of address space available, in <see langword="byte"/>s, for sparse memory resources.
This is an upper bound on the sum of the sizes of all sparse resources, regardless of whether any memory is bound to them.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxBoundDescripto: The maximum number of descriptor sets that can be simultaneously used by a pipeline. All <c>DescriptorSet</c> decorations in shader modules must have a value less than <see cref="MaxBoundDescriptorSets"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageDescri: The maximum number of samplers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
The maximum number of uniform buffers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
The maximum number of storage buffers that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
The maximum number of sampled images that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of , , or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
The maximum number of storage images that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of , or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
The maximum number of input attachments that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
A descriptor is accessible to a pipeline shader stage when has the bit for that shader stage set.
These are only supported for the fragment stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxPerStageResour: The maximum number of resources that can be accessible to a single shader stage in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of , , , , , , , , , or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
For the fragment shader stage the framebuffer color attachments also count against this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetS: The maximum number of samplers that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetU: The maximum number of uniform buffers that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
The maximum number of dynamic uniform buffers that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetS: The maximum number of storage buffers that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
The maximum number of dynamic storage buffers that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
The maximum number of sampled images that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of , , or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
The maximum number of storage images that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of , or count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDescriptorSetI: The maximum number of input attachments that can be included in a pipeline layout.

Descriptors with a type of count against this limit.
Only descriptors in descriptor set layouts created without the bit set count against this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputAtt: The maximum number of vertex input attributes that can be specified for a graphics pipeline.

These are described in the array of <see cref="VkVertexInputAttributeDescription"/>s that are provided at graphics pipeline creation time via <see cref="VkPipelineVertexInputStateCreateInfo.VertexAttributeDescriptions"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputBin: The maximum number of vertex buffers that can be specified for providing vertex attributes to a graphics pipeline.

These are described in the array of s that are provided at graphics pipeline creation time via .
must be less than this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputAtt: The maximum vertex input attribute offset that can be added to the vertex input binding stride.
<see cref="VkVertexInputAttributeDescription.Offset"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexInputBin: The maximum vertex input binding stride that can be specified in a vertex input binding.
<see cref="VkVertexInputBindingDescription.Stride"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxVertexOutputCo: The maximum number of components of output variables which can be output by a vertex shader.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationGe: The maximum tessellation generation level supported by the fixed-function tessellation primitive generator.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationPa: The maximum patch size, in vertices, of patches that can be processed by the tessellation control shader and tessellation primitive generator.

<see cref="VkPipelineTessellationStateCreateInfo.PatchControlPoints"/> specified at pipeline creation time and the value provided in the <c>OutputVertices</c> execution mode of shader modules must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationCo: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as per-vertex inputs to the tessellation control shader stage.
The maximum number of components of per-vertex output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.
The maximum number of components of per-patch output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.
The maximum total number of components of per-vertex and per-patch output variables which can be output from the tessellation control shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTessellationEv: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as per-vertex inputs to the tessellation evaluation shader stage.
The maximum number of components of per-vertex output variables which can be output from the tessellation evaluation shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryShader: The maximum invocation count supported for instanced geometry shaders.
The value provided in the <c>Invocations</c> execution mode of shader modules must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryInputC: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as inputs to the geometry shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryOutput: The maximum number of components of output variables which can be output from the geometry shader stage.
The maximum number of vertices which can be emitted by any geometry shader.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxGeometryTotalO: The maximum total number of components of output variables, across all emitted vertices, which can be output from the geometry shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentInputC: The maximum number of components of input variables which can be provided as inputs to the fragment shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentOutput: The maximum number of output attachments which can be written to by the fragment shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentDualSo: The maximum number of output attachments which can be written to by the fragment shader stage when blending is enabled and one of the dual source blend modes is in use.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFragmentCombin: The total number of storage buffers, storage images, and output Location decorated color attachments which can be used in the fragment shader stage.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeSharedM: The maximum total storage size, in <see langword="byte"/>s, available for variables declared with the <c>Workgroup</c> storage class in shader modules (or with the <c>shared</c> storage qualifier in GLSL) in the compute shader stage.

When variables declared with the Workgroup storage class are explicitly laid out (hence they are also decorated with Block), the amount of storage consumed is the size of the largest Block variable, not counting any padding at the end.
The amount of storage consumed by the non-Block variables declared with the Workgroup storage class is implementation-dependent.
However, the amount of storage consumed may not exceed the largest block size that would be obtained if all active non-Block variables declared with Workgroup storage class were assigned offsets in an arbitrary order by successively taking the smallest valid offset according to the standard storage buffer layout rules, and with Boolean values considered as 32-bit integer values for the purpose of this calculation. (This is equivalent to using the GLSL std430 layout rules.)
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxComputeWorkGro: The maximum number of local workgroups that can be dispatched by a single dispatching command.

These three values represent the maximum number of local workgroups for the X, Y, and Z dimensions, respectively. The workgroup count parameters to the dispatching commands must be less than or equal to the corresponding limit.
The maximum total number of compute shader invocations in a single local workgroup.

The product of the X, Y, and Z sizes, as specified by the <c>LocalSize</c> or <c>LocalSizeId</c> execution mode in shader modules or by the object decorated by the <c>WorkgroupSize</c> decoration, must be less than or equal to this limit.
The maximum size of a local compute workgroup, per dimension.

These three values represent the maximum local workgroup size in the X, Y, and Z dimensions, respectively.
The x, y, and z sizes, as specified by the LocalSize or LocalSizeId execution mode or by the object decorated by the WorkgroupSize decoration in shader modules, must be less than or equal to the corresponding limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SubPixelPrecision: The number of bits of subpixel precision in framebuffer coordinates xf and yf.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SubTexelPrecision: The number of bits of precision in the division along an axis of an image used for minification and magnification filters.

2 is the actual number of divisions along each axis of the image represented.
Sub-texel values calculated during image sampling will snap to these locations when generating the filtered results.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MipmapPrecisionBi: The number of bits of division that the LOD calculation for mipmap fetching get snapped to when determining the contribution from each mip level to the mip filtered results.
2 <see cref="<MipmapPrecisionBits"/> is the actual number of divisions.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDrawIndexedInd: The maximum index value that can be used for indexed draw calls when using 32-bit indices.
This excludes the primitive restart index value of 0xFFFFFFFF.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxDrawIndirectCo: The maximum draw count that is supported for indirect drawing calls.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerLodBias: The maximum absolute sampler LOD bias.

The sum of <see cref="VkSamplerCreateInfo.MipLodBias" and the <c>Bias</c> operand of image sampling operations in shader modules (or 0 if no <c>Bias</c> operand is provided to an image sampling operation) are clamped to the range [-<see cref="MaxSamplerLodBias"/>,+<see cref="MaxSamplerLodBias"/>].
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSamplerAnisotr: The maximum degree of sampler anisotropy.
The maximum degree of anisotropic filtering used for an image sampling operation is the minimum of <see cref="VkSamplerCreateInfo.MaxAnisotropy"/> and this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewports.summ: The maximum number of active viewports.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewports.rema: <see cref="VkPipelineViewportStateCreateInfo.ViewportCount"/> that is provided at pipeline creation must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxViewportDimens: The maximum viewport dimensions in the X (width) and Y (height) dimensions, respectively.
The maximum viewport dimensions must be greater than or equal to the largest image which can be created and used as a framebuffer attachment.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.ViewportBoundsRan: The [minimum, maximum] range that the corners of a viewport must be contained in.
This range must be at least [-2 × <c>size</c>, 2 × <c>size</c> - 1], where <c>size</c> = max(<see cref="MaxViewportDimensions[0]"/>, <see cref="MaxViewportDimensions[1]"/>).
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.ViewportSubPixelB: The number of bits of subpixel precision for viewport bounds.
The subpixel precision that floating-point viewport bounds are interpreted at is given by this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinMemoryMapAlign: The minimum required alignment, in <see langword="byte"/>s, of host visible memory allocations within the host address space.

When mapping a memory allocation with , subtracting offset s from the returned pointer will always produce an integer multiple of this limit.
The value must be a power of two.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelBufferOff: The minimum required alignment, in <see langword="byte"/>s, for <see cref="VkBufferViewCreateInfo.Offset"/> for texel buffers.

The value must be a power of two.
If is enabled, this limit is equivalent to the maximum of and , but smaller alignment is optionally allowed by and .
If is not enabled, must be a multiple of this value.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinUniformBufferO: The minimum required alignment, in <see langword="byte"/>s, <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Offset"/> for uniform buffers.

When a descriptor of type or is updated, the offset must be an integer multiple of this limit.
Similarly, dynamic offsets for uniform buffers must be multiples of this limit.
The value must be a power of two.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinStorageBufferO: The minimum required alignment, in <see langword="byte"/>s, <see cref="VkDescriptorBufferInfo.Offset"/> for storage buffers.

When a descriptor of type or is updated, the offset must be an integer multiple of this limit.
Similarly, dynamic offsets for storage buffers must be multiples of this limit.
The value must be a power of two.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelOffset.su: The minimum offset value for the <c>ConstOffset</c> image operand of any of the <c>OpImageSample*</c> or <c>OpImageFetch*</c> image instructions.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelOffset.su: The maximum offset value for the <c>ConstOffset</c> image operand of any of the <c>OpImageSample*</c> or <c>OpImageFetch*</c> image instructions.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinTexelGatherOff: The minimum offset value for the <c>Offset</c>, <c>ConstOffset</c>, or <c>ConstOffsets</c> image operands of any of the <c>OpImage*Gather</c> image instructions.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxTexelGatherOff: The maximum offset value for the <c>Offset</c>, <c>ConstOffset</c>, or <c>ConstOffsets</c> image operands of any of the <c>OpImage*Gather</c> image instructions.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MinInterpolationO: The base minimum (inclusive) negative offset value for the <c>Offset</c> operand of the <c>InterpolateAtOffset</c> extended instruction.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxInterpolationO: The base maximum (inclusive) positive offset value for the <c>Offset</c> operand of the <c>InterpolateAtOffset</c> extended instruction.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SubPixelInterpola: The number of fractional bits that the <c>x</c> and <c>y</c> offsets to the <c>InterpolateAtOffset</c> extended instruction may be rounded to as fixed-point values.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferWid: The maximum width for a framebuffer.
<see cref="VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Width"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferHei: The maximum height for a framebuffer.
<see cref="VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Height"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxFramebufferLay: The maximum layer count for a layered framebuffer.
<see cref="VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Layers"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferColorS: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the color sample counts that are supported for all framebuffer color attachments with floating- or fixed-point formats.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferDepthS: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the supported depth sample counts for all framebuffer depth/stencil attachments, when the format includes a depth component.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferStenci: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the supported stencil sample counts for all framebuffer depth/stencil attachments, when the format includes a stencil component.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.FramebufferNoAtta: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the supported sample counts for a subpass which uses no attachments.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxColorAttachmen: The maximum number of color attachments that can be used by a subpass in a render pass.
<see cref="VkSubpassDescription.ColorAttachmentCount"/> or <see cref="VkSubpassDescription2.ColorAttachmentCount"/> must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageColor: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>, <c>usage</c> containing <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Sampled"/>, and a non-integer color format.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageInteg: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>, <c>usage</c> containing <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Sampled"/>, and an integer color format.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageDepth: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>, <c>usage</c> containing <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Sampled"/>, and a depth format.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.SampledImageStenc: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>, <c>usage</c> containing <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Sampled"/>, and a stencil format.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.StorageImageSampl: A <see cref="VkSampleCountFlags"/> bitmask indicating the sample counts supported for all 2D images created with <see cref="VkImageTiling.Optimal"/>, and <c>usage</c> containing <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags.Storage"/>.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxSampleMaskWord: The maximum number of array elements of a variable decorated with the <c>SampleMask</c> built-in decoration.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.TimestampComputeA: Specifies support for timestamps on all graphics and compute queues.

If this limit is set to <see cref="VK.True"/>, all queues that advertise the <see cref="VKQueueFlags.Graphics"/> or <see cref="VKQueueFlags.Compute"/> in the <see cref="VkQueueFamilyProperties.QueueFlags"/> support <see cref="VkQueueFamilyProperties.TimestampValidBits"/> of at least 36.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.TimestampPeriod.s: The number of nanoseconds required for a timestamp query to be incremented by 1.
The maximum number of clip distances that can be used in a single shader stage.
The size of any array declared with the <c>ClipDistance</c> built-in decoration in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.
The maximum number of cull distances that can be used in a single shader stage.
The size of any array declared with the <c>CullDistance</c> built-in decoration in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.MaxCombinedClipAn: The maximum combined number of clip and cull distances that can be used in a single shader stage.

The sum of the sizes of any pair of arrays declared with the <c>ClipDistance</c> and <c>CullDistance</c> built-in decoration used by a single shader stage in a shader module must be less than or equal to this limit.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.DiscreteQueuePrio: The number of discrete priorities that can be assigned to a queue based on the value of each member of <see cref="VkDeviceQueueCreateInfo.QueuePriorities"/>.
This must be at least 2, and levels must be spread evenly over the range, with at least one level at 1.0, and another at 0.0.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.PointSizeRange.su: The range [<c>minimum</c>,<c>maximum</c>] of supported sizes for points.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.PointSizeRange.re: Values written to variables decorated with the <c>PointSize</c> built-in decoration are clamped to this range.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.LineWidthRange.su: The range [<c>minimum</c>,<c>maximum</c>] of supported widths for lines.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.LineWidthRange.re: Values specified by <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.LineWidth"/> or the <c>lineWidth</c> parameter to <see cref="VK.CommandSetLineWidth"/> are clamped to this range.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.PointSizeGranular: The granularity of supported point sizes.

Not all point sizes in the range defined by are supported.
This limit specifies the granularity (or increment) between successive supported point sizes.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.LineWidthGranular: The granularity of supported line widths.

Not all line widths in the range defined by are supported.
This limit specifies the granularity (or increment) between successive supported line widths.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.StrictLines.summa: Whether lines are rasterized according to the preferred method of rasterization.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.StrictLines.remar:
If set to , lines may be rasterized under a relaxed set of rules.
If set to , lines are rasterized as per the strict definition.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.StandardSampleLoc: Whether rasterization uses the standard sample locations.

If set to , the implementation uses the documented sample locations.
If set to , the implementation may use different sample locations.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.OptimalBufferCopy: The optimal buffer offset alignment in <see langword="byte"/>s for <see cref="VK.CommandCopyBufferToImage2"/>, <see cref="VK.CommandCopyBufferToImage"/>, <see cref="VK.CommandCopyImageToBuffer2"/>, and <see cref="VK.CommandCopyImageToBuffer"/>.

The per texel alignment requirements are enforced, but applications should use the optimal alignment for optimal performance and power use.
The value must be a power of two.

The optimal buffer row pitch alignment in <see langword="byte"/>s for <see cref="VK.CommandCopyBufferToImage2"/>, <see cref="VK.CommandCopyBufferToImage"/>, <see cref="VK.CommandCopyImageToBuffer2"/>, and <see cref="VK.CommandCopyImageToBuffer"/>.

Row pitch is the number of s between texels with the same X coordinate in adjacent rows (Y coordinates differ by one).
The per texel alignment requirements are enforced, but applications should use the optimal alignment for optimal performance and power use.
The value must be a power of two.
VkPhysicalDeviceLimits.NonCoherentAtomSi: The size and alignment in <see cref="byte"/>s that bounds concurrent access to host-mapped device memory.
The value must be a power of two.
VkSemaphoreCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created semaphore.
VkSemaphoreCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created query pool.
VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.QueryType.summary: A <see cref="VkQueryType"/> value specifying the type of queries managed by the pool.
VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.QueryCount.summary: The number of queries managed by the pool.
VkQueryPoolCreateInfo.PipelineStatistics: A <see cref="VkQueryPipelineStatisticFlags"/> bitmask specifying which counters will be returned in queries on the new pool.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created framebuffer.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.RenderPass.summa: A render pass defining what render passes the framebuffer will be compatible with.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Attachments.summ: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkImageView"/> handles, each of which will be used as the corresponding attachment in a render pass instance.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Attachments.rema: If <see cref="Flags"/> includes <see cref="VkFramebufferCreateFlags.Imageless"/>, this parameter is ignored.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Layers.summary: The number of layers of the framebuffer.
VkFramebufferCreateInfo.Layers.remarks: If the render pass uses multiview, then this must be one and each attachment requires a number of layers that is greater than the maximum bit index set in the view mask in the subpasses in which it is used.
VkDrawIndirectCommand.summary: Structure specifying a indirect drawing command.
VkDrawIndirectCommand.VertexCount.summar: The number of vertices to draw.
VkDrawIndirectCommand.InstanceCount.summ: The number of instances to draw.
VkDrawIndirectCommand.FirstVertex.summar: The index of the first vertex to draw.
VkDrawIndirectCommand.FirstInstance.summ: The instance ID of the first instance to draw.
VkDrawIndexedIndirectCommand.summary: Structure specifying a indexed indirect drawing command.
The number of vertices to draw.
VkDrawIndexedIndirectCommand.InstanceCou: The number of instances to draw.
The base index within the index buffer.
VkDrawIndexedIndirectCommand.VertexOffse: The value added to the vertex index before indexing into the vertex buffer.
VkDrawIndexedIndirectCommand.FirstInstan: The instance ID of the first instance to draw.
VkDispatchIndirectCommand.summary: Structure specifying a indirect dispatching command.
VkDispatchIndirectCommand.X.summary: The number of local workgroups to dispatch in the X dimension.
VkDispatchIndirectCommand.Y.summary: The number of local workgroups to dispatch in the Y dimension.
VkDispatchIndirectCommand.Z.summary: The number of local workgroups to dispatch in the Z dimension.
VkMultiDrawInfoEXT.VertexCount.summary: The number of vertices to draw.
VkMultiDrawIndexedInfoEXT.IndexCount.sum: The number of vertices to draw.
VkMultiDrawIndexedInfoEXT.VertexOffset.s: The value added to the vertex index before indexing into the vertex buffer for indexed multidraws.
VkSubmitInfo.summary: Structure specifying a queue submit operation.
VkSubmitInfo.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkSubmitInfo.WaitSemaphoreCount.summary: The number of semaphores upon which to wait before executing the command buffers for the batch.
VkSubmitInfo.WaitSemaphores.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSemaphore"/> handles upon which to wait before the command buffers for this batch begin execution.
VkSubmitInfo.WaitSemaphores.remarks: If semaphores to wait on are provided, they define a semaphore wait operation.
VkSubmitInfo.WaitDestinationStageMask.su: A pointer to an array of pipeline stages at which each corresponding semaphore wait will occur.
VkSubmitInfo.CommandBufferCount.summary: The number of command buffers to execute in the batch.
VkSubmitInfo.CommandBuffers.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkCommandBuffer"/> handles to execute in the batch.
VkSubmitInfo.SignalSemaphoreCount.summar: The number of semaphores to be signaled once the commands specified in <see cref="CommandBuffers"/> have completed execution.
VkSubmitInfo.SignalSemaphores.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSemaphore"/> handles which will be signaled when the command buffers for this batch have completed execution.
VkSubmitInfo.SignalSemaphores.remarks: If semaphores to be signaled are provided, they define a semaphore signal operation.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.summary: Structure describing an available display device.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Display.summary: A handle that is used to refer to the display described here.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.Display.remarks: This handle will be valid for the lifetime of the Vulkan instance.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.DisplayName.summa: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string containing the name of the display.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.DisplayName.remar:
Generally, this will be the name provided by the display’s EDID.
If , no suitable name is available.
If not , the string pointed to must remain accessible and unmodified as long as display is valid.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.PhysicalDimension: The physical width and height of the visible portion of the display, in millimeters.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.PhysicalResolutio: The physical, native, or preferred resolution of the display.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.SupportedTransfor: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagBitsKHR"/> bitmask describing which transforms are supported by this display.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.PlaneReorderPossi: Whether the planes on this display can have their z order changed.
If this is <see cref="VK.True"/>, the application can re-arrange the planes on this display in any order relative to each other.
VkDisplayPropertiesKHR.PersistentContent: Whether the display supports self-refresh/internal buffering.
If this is <see cref="VK.True"/>, the application can submit persistent present operations on swapchains created against this display.
VkDisplayPlanePropertiesKHR.CurrentDispl: The handle of the display the plane is currently associated with. If the plane is not currently attached to any displays, this will be <see cref="VkDisplayKHR.Null"/>.
VkDisplayPlanePropertiesKHR.CurrentStack: The current z-order of the plane. This will be between 0 and the value returned by <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceDisplayPlanePropertiesKHR"/> in <c>propertyCount</c>.
VkDisplayModeParametersKHR.summary: Structure describing display parameters associated with a display mode.
VkDisplayModeParametersKHR.VisibleRegion: The 2D extents of the visible region.
VkDisplayModeParametersKHR.RefreshRate.s: A <see langword="int"/> that is the number of times the display is refreshed each second multiplied by 1000.
VkDisplayModePropertiesKHR.DisplayMode.s: A handle to the display mode described in this structure.
VkDisplayModePropertiesKHR.DisplayMode.r: This handle will be valid for the lifetime of the Vulkan instance.
VkDisplayModePropertiesKHR.Parameters.su: A <see cref="VkDisplayModeParametersKHR"/> structure describing the display parameters associated with <see cref="DisplayMode"/>.
VkDisplayModeCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created display mode object.
VkDisplayModeCreateInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDisplayModeCreateInfoKHR.Flags.summary: Reserved for future use, and must be zero.
VkDisplayModeCreateInfoKHR.Parameters.su: A <see cref="VkDisplayModeParametersKHR"/> structure describing the display parameters to use in creating the new mode.
VkDisplayModeCreateInfoKHR.Parameters.re: If the parameters are not compatible with the specified display, the implementation must return <see cref="VkResult.ErrorInitializationFailed"/>.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.summary: Structure describing capabilities of a mode and plane combination.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.SupportedA: A <see cref="VkDisplayPlaneAlphaFlagsKHR"/> bitmask describing the supported alpha blending modes.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MinSourceP: The minimum source rectangle offset supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MaxSourceP: The maximum source rectangle offset supported by this plane using the specified mode.
The <c>x</c> and <c>y</c> components of <see cref="MaxSourcePosition"/> must each be greater than or equal to the <c>x</c> and <c>y</c> components of <see cref="MinSourcePosition"/>, respectively.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MinSourceE: The minimum source rectangle size supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MaxSourceE: The maximum source rectangle size supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MinDestina: The minimum destination rectangle offset supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MaxDestina: The maximum destination rectangle offset supported by this plane using the specified mode.

The <c>x</c> and <c>y</c> components of <see cref="MaxDestinationPosition"/> must each be greater than or equal to the <c>x</c> and <c>y</c> components of <see cref="MinDestinationPosition"/>, respectively.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MinDestina: The minimum destination rectangle size supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplayPlaneCapabilitiesKHR.MaxDestina: The maximum destination rectangle size supported by this plane using the specified mode.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created display plane surface object.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Next.summa: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Flags.summ: Reserved for future use, and must be zero.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.DisplayMod: A <see cref="VkDisplayModeKHR"/> handle specifying the mode to use when displaying this surface.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.PlaneIndex: The plane on which this surface appears.
A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagsKHR"/> value specifying the transformation to apply to images as part of the scanout operation.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.GlobalAlph: This value is ignored if <see cref="AlphaMode"/> is not <see cref="VkDisplayPlaneAlphaFlagsKHR.GlobalKhr"/>.
A <see cref="VkDisplayPlaneAlphaFlagsKHR"/> value specifying the type of alpha blending to use.
VkDisplaySurfaceCreateInfoKHR.ImageExten: The size of the presentable images to use with the surface.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.summary: Structure describing parameters of a queue presentation to a swapchain.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.SourceRect.summa: A rectangular region of pixels to present.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.SourceRect.remar:
It must be a subset of the image being presented.
If is not specified, this region will be assumed to be the entire presentable image.
A rectangular region within the visible region of the swapchain’s display mode.

If is not specified, this region will be assumed to be the entire visible region of the swapchain’s mode.
If the specified rectangle is a subset of the display mode’s visible region, content from display planes below the swapchain’s plane will be visible outside the rectangle.
If there are no planes below the swapchain’s, the area outside the specified rectangle will be black.
If portions of the specified rectangle are outside of the display’s visible region, pixels mapping only to those portions of the rectangle will be discarded.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.Persistent.summa: If this is <see cref="VK.True"/>, the display engine will enable buffered mode on displays that support it.
VkDisplayPresentInfoKHR.Persistent.remar:
This allows the display engine to stop sending content to the display until a new image is presented.
The display will instead maintain a copy of the last presented image.
This allows less power to be used, but may increase presentation latency.
If is not specified, persistent mode will not be used.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.summary: Structure describing capabilities of a surface.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.MinImageCount.s: The minimum number of images the specified device supports for a swapchain created for the surface, and will be at least one.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.MaxImageCount.s: The maximum number of images the specified device supports for a swapchain created for the surface, and will be either 0, or greater than or equal to <see cref="MinImageCount"/>.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.MaxImageCount.r: A value of 0 means that there is no limit on the number of images, though there may be limits related to the total amount of memory used by presentable images.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.CurrentExtent.s: The current width and height of the surface, or the special value (0xFFFFFFFF, 0xFFFFFFFF) indicating that the surface size will be determined by the extent of a swapchain targeting the surface.
The smallest valid swapchain extent for the surface on the specified device. The <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of the extent will each be less than or equal to the corresponding <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of <see cref="CurrentExtent"/>, unless <see cref="CurrentExtent"/> has the special value described above.
The largest valid swapchain extent for the surface on the specified device. The <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of the extent will each be greater than or equal to the corresponding <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of <see cref="MinImageExtent"/>. The <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of the extent will each be greater than or equal to the corresponding <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of <see cref="CurrentExtent"/>, unless <see cref="CurrentExtent"/> has the special value (in <see cref="CurrentExtent"/> summary).
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.MaxImageArrayLa: The maximum number of layers presentable images can have for a swapchain created for this device and surface, and will be at least one.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.SupportedTransf: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagsKHR"/> bitmask indicating the presentation transforms supported for the surface on the specified device.
At least one bit will be set.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.CurrentTransfor: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagsKHR"/> bitmask indicating the surface’s current transform relative to the presentation engine’s natural orientation.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.SupportedCompos: A <see cref="VkCompositeAlphaFlagsKHR"/> bitmask representing the alpha compositing modes supported by the presentation engine for the surface on the specified device, and at least one bit will be set.

Opaque composition can be achieved in any alpha compositing mode by either using an image format that has no alpha component, or by ensuring that all pixels in the presentable images have an alpha value of 1.0.
VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.SupportedUsageF: A <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags"/> bitmask representing the ways the application can use the presentable images of a swapchain created with <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR"/> set to <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.ImmediateKhr"/>, <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.MailboxKhr"/>, <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.FifoKhr"/> or <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.FifoRelaxedKhr"/> for the surface on the specified device.

must be included in the set.
Implementations may support additional usages.
VkAndroidSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created Android surface object.
VkAndroidSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Next.summa: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkAndroidSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Window.sum: A pointer to the <c>ANativeWindow</c> to associate the surface with.
VkWin32SurfaceCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created Win32 surface object.
VkWin32SurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkWin32SurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Hinstance.su: The Win32 <c>HINSTANCE</c> for the window to associate the surface with.
VkWin32SurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Hwnd.summary: The Win32 <c>HWND</c> for the window to associate the surface with.
VkXlibSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created Xlib surface object.
VkXlibSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkXlibSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Dpy.summary: A pointer to an Xlib <c>Display</c> connection to the X server.
VkXlibSurfaceCreateInfoKHR.Window.summar: An Xlib <c>Window</c> to associate the surface with.
VkSurfaceFormatKHR.summary: Structure describing a supported swapchain format-color space pair.
VkSurfaceFormatKHR.Format.summary: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> that is compatible with the specified surface.
VkSurfaceFormatKHR.ColorSpace.summary: A presentation <see cref="VkColorSpaceKHR"/> that is compatible with the surface.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.summary: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created swapchain object.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Flags.summary: A <see cref="VkSwapchainCreateFlagsKHR"/> bitmask indicating parameters of the swapchain creation.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Surface.summary: The surface onto which the swapchain will present images.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Surface.remarks: If the creation succeeds, the swapchain becomes associated with surface.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.MinImageCount.s: The minimum number of presentable images that the application needs.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.MinImageCount.r: The implementation will either create the swapchain with at least that many images, or it will fail to create the swapchain.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageFormat.sum: A <see cref="VkFormat"/> value specifying the format the swapchain image(s) will be created with.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageColorSpace: A <see cref="VkColorSpaceKHR"/> value specifying the way the swapchain interprets image data.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageExtent.sum: The size (in pixels) of the swapchain image(s).
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageExtent.rem: The behavior is platform-dependent if the image extent does not match the surface’s <c>currentExtent</c> as returned by <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR"/>.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageArrayLayer: The number of views in a multiview/stereo surface.
For non-stereoscopic-3D applications, this value is 1.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageUsage.summ: A <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags"/> bitmask describing the intended usage of the (acquired) swapchain images.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.ImageSharingMod: The sharing mode used for the image(s) of the swapchain.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.QueueFamilyInde: The number of queue families having access to the image(s) of the swapchain when <see cref="ImageSharingMode"/> is <see cref="VkSharingMode.Concurrent"/>.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.QueueFamilyIndi: A pointer to an array of queue family indices having access to the images(s) of the swapchain when <see cref="ImageSharingMode"/> is <see cref="VkSharingMode.Concurrent"/>.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.PreTransform.su: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagsKHR"/> bitmask describing the transform, relative to the presentation engine’s natural orientation, applied to the image content prior to presentation.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.PreTransform.re: If it does not match the <c>currentTransform</c> value returned by <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR"/>, the presentation engine will transform the image content as part of the presentation operation.
A <see cref="VkCompositeAlphaFlagsKHR"/> bitmask indicating the alpha compositing mode to use when this surface is composited together with other surfaces on certain window systems.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.PresentMode.sum: The presentation mode the swapchain will use.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.PresentMode.rem: A swapchain’s present mode determines how incoming present requests will be processed and queued internally.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Clipped.summary: Whether the Vulkan implementation is allowed to discard rendering operations that affect regions of the surface that are not visible.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Clipped.remarks:
If set to , the presentable images associated with the swapchain may not own all of their pixels.
Pixels in the presentable images that correspond to regions of the target surface obscured by another window on the desktop, or subject to some other clipping mechanism will have undefined content when read back.
Fragment shaders may not execute for these pixels, and thus any side effects they would have had will not occur.
Setting does not guarantee any clipping will occur, but allows more efficient presentation methods to be used on some platforms.
If set to , presentable images associated with the swapchain will own all of the pixels they contain.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.OldSwapchain.su: <see cref="VkSwapchainKHR.Null"/>, or the existing non-retired swapchain currently associated with surface.
VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.OldSwapchain.re: Providing a valid <see cref="OldSwapchain"/> may aid in the resource reuse, and also allows the application to still present any images that are already acquired from it.
VkPresentInfoKHR.summary: Structure describing parameters of a queue presentation.
VkPresentInfoKHR.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPresentInfoKHR.WaitSemaphoreCount.summ: The number of semaphores to wait for before issuing the present request.
VkPresentInfoKHR.WaitSemaphores.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSemaphore"/> objects with <see cref="WaitSemaphoreCount"/> entries, and specifies the semaphores to wait for before issuing the present request.
VkPresentInfoKHR.SwapchainCount.summary: The number of swapchains being presented to by this command.
VkPresentInfoKHR.Swapchains.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkSwapchainKHR"/> objects with <see cref="SwapchainCount"/> entries.
VkPresentInfoKHR.Swapchains.remarks: A given swapchain must not appear in this list more than once.
VkPresentInfoKHR.ImageIndices.summary: A pointer to an array of indices into the array of each swapchain’s presentable images, with <see cref="SwapchainCount"/> entries.
VkPresentInfoKHR.ImageIndices.remarks: Each entry in this array identifies the image to present on the corresponding entry in the <see cref="Swapchains"/> array.
VkPresentInfoKHR.Results.summary: A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkResult"/> typed elements with <see cref="SwapchainCount"/> entries.
VkPresentInfoKHR.Results.remarks: Applications that do not need per-swapchain results can use <see langword="null"/> for <see cref="Results"/>. If non-<see langword="null"/>, each entry in <see cref="Results"/> will be set to the <see cref="VkResult"/> for presenting the swapchain corresponding to the same index in <see cref="Swapchains"/>.
VkDebugReportCallbackCreateInfoEXT.summa: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created debug report callback.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDebugReportCallbackCreateInfoEXT.Flags: A <see cref="VkDebugReportFlagBitsEXT"/> bitmask specifying which event(s) will cause this callback to be called.
VkDebugReportCallbackCreateInfoEXT.Callb: The application callback function to call.
VkDebugReportCallbackCreateInfoEXT.UserD: User data to be passed to the callback.
VkValidationFlagsEXT.summary: Specify validation checks to disable for a Vulkan instance.
VkValidationFlagsEXT.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkValidationFlagsEXT.DisabledValidationC: The number of checks to disable.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkValidationCheckEXT"/> values specifying the validation checks to be disabled.
VkValidationFeaturesEXT.summary: Specify validation features to enable or disable for a Vulkan instance.
VkValidationFeaturesEXT.remarks: When creating a Vulkan instance for which you wish to enable or disable specific validation features, add a <see cref="VkValidationFeaturesEXT"/> structure to <see cref="VkInstanceCreateInfo.Next"/>, specifying the features to be enabled or disabled.
VkValidationFeaturesEXT.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkValidationFeaturesEXT.EnabledValidatio: The number of features to enable.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkValidationFeatureEnableEXT"/> values specifying the validation features to be enabled.
VkValidationFeaturesEXT.DisabledValidati: The number of features to disable.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkValidationFeatureDisableEXT"/> values specifying the validation features to be disabled.
VkPipelineRasterizationStateRasterizatio: Structure defining rasterization order for a graphics pipeline.

The rasterization order to use for a graphics pipeline is specified by adding a <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateRasterizationOrderAMD"/> structure to <see cref="VkPipelineRasterizationStateCreateInfo.Next"/>.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
A <see cred="VkRasterizationOrderAMD"/> value specifying the primitive rasterization order to use.
VkDebugMarkerObjectNameInfoEXT.summary: Specify parameters of a name to give to an object.
VkDebugMarkerObjectNameInfoEXT.Next.summ: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDebugMarkerObjectNameInfoEXT.ObjectTyp: A <see cref="VkDebugReportObjectTypeEXT"/> specifying the type of the object to be named.
VkDebugMarkerObjectNameInfoEXT.ObjectNam: A null-terminated UTF-8 string specifying the name to apply to <see cref="Object"/>.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.summary: Specify parameters of a tag to attach to an object.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.Next.summa: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.ObjectType: A <see cref="VkDebugReportObjectTypeEXT"/> specifying the type of the object to be named.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.TagName.su: A numerical identifier of the tag.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.TagSize.su: The number of <see langword="byte"/>s of data to attach to the object.
VkDebugMarkerObjectTagInfoEXT.Tag.summar: A pointer to an array of <see cref="TagSize"/> <see langword="byte"/>s containing the data to be associated with the object.
VkDebugMarkerMarkerInfoEXT.summary: Specify parameters of a command buffer marker region.
VkDebugMarkerMarkerInfoEXT.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDebugMarkerMarkerInfoEXT.MarkerName.su: A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string containing the name of the marker.
VkDebugMarkerMarkerInfoEXT.Color.summary: An optional RGBA color value that can be associated with the marker.
VkDebugMarkerMarkerInfoEXT.Color.remarks:
A particular implementation may choose to ignore this color value.
The values contain RGBA values in order, in the range 0.0 to 1.0.
If all elements in are set to 0.0 then it is ignored.
VkDedicatedAllocationImageCreateInfoNV.s: Specify that an image is bound to a dedicated memory resource.
VkDedicatedAllocationImageCreateInfoNV.r: If the <c>Next</c> chain includes a <see cref="VkDedicatedAllocationImageCreateInfoNV"/> structure, then that structure includes an enable controlling whether the image will have a dedicated memory allocation bound to it.
VkDedicatedAllocationImageCreateInfoNV.N: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDedicatedAllocationImageCreateInfoNV.D: Whether the image will have a dedicated allocation bound to it.
Specify that a buffer is bound to a dedicated memory resource.

If the <c>Next</c> chain includes a <see cref="VkDedicatedAllocationBufferCreateInfoNV"/> structure, then that structure includes an enable controlling whether the buffer will have a dedicated memory allocation bound to it.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
Whether the buffer will have a dedicated allocation bound to it.
VkDedicatedAllocationMemoryAllocateInfoN: Specify a dedicated memory allocation resource.

If the <c>Next</c> chain includes a <see cref="VkDedicatedAllocationMemoryAllocateInfoNV"/> structure, then that structure includes a handle of the sole buffer or image resource that the memory can be bound to.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
<see cref="VkImage.Null"/> or a handle of an image which this memory will be bound to.
<see cref="VkBuffer.Null"/> or a handle of a buffer which this memory will be bound to.
VkExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV.summar: Structure specifying external image format properties.
VkExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV.ImageF: Will be filled in as when calling <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties"/>, but the values returned may vary depending on the external handle type requested.
VkExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV.Extern: A <see cref="VkExternalMemoryFeatureFlagBitsNV"/> bitmask indicating properties of the external memory handle type (<c>externalHandleType</c> <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV"/>) being queried, or 0 if the external memory handle type is 0.
VkExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV.Export: A <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlagBitsNV"/> bitmask containing a bit set for every external handle type that may be used to create memory from which the handles of the type specified in <c>externalHandleType</c> <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV"/> can be exported, or 0 if the external memory handle type is 0.
VkExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV.Compat: A <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlagBitsNV"/> bitmask containing a bit set for every external handle type that may be specified simultaneously with the handle type specified by <c>externalHandleType</c> <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV"/> when calling <see cref="VK.AllocateMemory"/>, or 0 if the external memory handle type is 0. <see cref="CompatibleHandleTypes"/> will always contain <c>externalHandleType</c> <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV"/>.
VkExternalMemoryImageCreateInfoNV.summar: Specify that an image may be backed by external memory.
VkExternalMemoryImageCreateInfoNV.remark: If the <c>Next</c> chain includes a <see cref="VkExternalMemoryImageCreateInfoNV"/> structure, then that structure defines a set of external memory handle types that may be used as backing store for the image.
VkExternalMemoryImageCreateInfoNV.Next.s: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkExternalMemoryImageCreateInfoNV.Handle: Zero or a <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlagBitsNV"/> bitmask specifying one or more external memory handle types.
VkExportMemoryAllocateInfoNV.summary: Specify memory handle types that may be exported.
VkExportMemoryAllocateInfoNV.Next.summar: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkExportMemoryAllocateInfoNV.HandleTypes: A <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlagBitsNV"/> bitmask specifying one or more memory handle types that may be exported. Multiple handle types may be requested for the same allocation as long as they are compatible, as reported by <see cref="VK.GetPhysicalDeviceExternalImageFormatPropertiesNV"/>.
VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.summary: Import Win32 memory created on the same physical device.
VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.remarks: To import memory created on the same physical device but outside of the current Vulkan instance, add a <see cref="VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV"/> structure to <see cref="VkMemoryAllocateInfo.Next"/>, specifying a handle to and the type of the memory.
VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.Next.sum: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.HandleTy: 0 or a <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlagBitsNV"/> value specifying the type of memory handle in handle.
VkImportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.Handle.s: An <see cref="IntPtr"/> referring to the memory.
VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.summary: Specify security attributes and access rights for Win32 memory handles.
VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.remarks: When <see cref="VkExportMemoryAllocateInfoNV.HandleTypes"/> includes <see cref="VkExternalMemoryHandleTypeFlags.OpaqueWin32Nv"/>, add a <see cref="VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV"/> structure to <see cref="VkExportMemoryAllocateInfoNV.Next"/> to specify security attributes and access rights for the memory object’s external handle.
VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.Next.sum: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.Attribut: A pointer to a <see cref="SecurityAttributes"/> structure specifying security attributes of the handle.
VkExportMemoryWin32HandleInfoNV.DwAccess: A <see langword="uint"/> specifying access rights of the handle.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoNV.su: Use Windows keyex mutex mechanism to synchronize work.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoNV.re:
When submitting work that operates on memory imported from a Direct3D 11 resource to a queue, the keyed mutex mechanism may be used in addition to Vulkan semaphores to synchronize the work. Keyed mutexes are a property of a properly created shareable Direct3D 11 resource. They can only be used if the imported resource was created with the D3D11_RESOURCE_MISC_SHARED_KEYEDMUTEX flag.
To acquire keyed mutexes before submitted work and/or release them after, add to .
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoNV.Ne: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoNV.Ac: The number of entries in <see cref="AcquireSyncs"/>, <see cref="AcquireKeys"/>, and <see cref="AcquireTimeoutMilliseconds"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> objects which were imported from Direct3D 11 resources.
A pointer to an array of mutex key values to wait for prior to beginning the submitted work.
Entries refer to the keyed mutex associated with the corresponding entries in <see cref="AcquireSyncs"/>.
A pointer to an array of timeout values, in millisecond units, for each acquire specified in <see cref="AcquireKeys"/>.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoNV.Re: The number of entries in <see cref="ReleaseSyncs"/> and <see cref="ReleaseKeys"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> objects which were imported from Direct3D 11 resources.
A pointer to an array of mutex key values to set when the submitted work has completed.
Entries refer to the keyed mutex associated with the corresponding entries in <see cref="ReleaseSyncs"/>.

The maximum number of tokens in <see cref="VkIndirectCommandsLayoutCreateInfoNV"/>.
The maximum number of streams in <see cref="VkIndirectCommandsLayoutCreateInfoNV"/>.
The minimum alignment for memory addresses which can be used in <see cref="VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV"/>.
The minimum alignment for memory addresses which can be used in <see cref="VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV"/>.
The minimum alignment for memory addresses used in <see cref="VkIndirectCommandsStreamNV"/>, and as preprocess buffer in <see cref="VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV"/>.

VkGraphicsShaderGroupCreateInfoNV.StageC: The number of entries in the <see cref="Stages"/>.

VkSetStateFlagsIndirectCommandNV.Data.re: Bit 0: If set represents <see cref="VkFrontFace.Clockwise"/>, otherwise <see cref="VkFrontFace.CounterClockwise"/>
VkIndirectCommandsStreamNV.summary: Structure specifying input streams for generated command tokens.

VkIndirectCommandsStreamNV.Buffer.remark: These arguments can be written by the device.
VkIndirectCommandsStreamNV.Offset.summar: An offset into <see cref="Buffer"/> where the arguments start.

VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV.PreprocessBuff: The <see cref="VkBuffer"/> that is used for preprocessing the input data for execution.

If this structure is used with <see cref="VK.CommandExecuteGeneratedCommandsNV"/> with its <c>isPreprocessed</c> set to <see cref="VK.True"/>, then the preprocessing step is skipped and data is only read from this buffer. The contents and the layout of this buffer is opaque to applications and must not be modified or copied to another buffer for reuse.

VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV.PreprocessSize: The maximum <see langword="byte"/> size within the <see cref="PreprocessBuffer"/> after the <see cref="PreprocessOffset"/> that is available for preprocessing.
VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV.SequencesCount: A <see cref="VkBuffer"/> in which the actual number of sequences is provided as single <see langword="int"/> value.

VkGeneratedCommandsInfoNV.SequencesIndex: A <see cref="VkBuffer"/> that encodes the used sequence indices as <see langword="int"/> array.
The <see langword="byte"/> offset into <see cref="SequencesIndexBuffer"/> where the index values start.

VkPresentRegionsKHR.summary: Structure hint of rectangular regions changed by <see cref="VK.QueuePresentKHR"/>.
VkPresentRegionsKHR.remarks: When the <see cref="VK.KhrIncrementalPresentExtensionName"/> extension is enabled, additional fields can be specified that allow an application to specify that only certain rectangular regions of the presentable images of a swapchain are changed. This is an optimization hint that a presentation engine may use to only update the region of a surface that is actually changing. The application still must ensure that all pixels of a presented image contain the desired values, in case the presentation engine ignores this hint. An application can provide this hint by adding a <see cref="VkPresentRegionsKHR"/> structure to <see cref="VkPresentInfoKHR.Next"/>.
