VkPresentRegionKHR.Rectangles.remarks: The <see cref="VkRectLayerKHR"/> structure is the framebuffer coordinates, plus layer, of a portion of a presentable image that has changed and must be presented. If non-<see langword="null"/>, each entry in <see cref="Rectangles"/> is a rectangle of the given image that has changed since the last image was presented to the given swapchain. The rectangles must be specified relative to <see cref="VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.CurrentTransform"/>, regardless of the swapchain's <c>preTransform</c>. The presentation engine will apply the <c>preTransform</c> transformation to the rectangles, along with any further transformation it applies to the image content.

VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoKHR.s: Use the Windows keyed mutex mechanism to synchronize work.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoKHR.r:
When submitting work that operates on memory imported from a Direct3D 11 resource to a queue, the keyed mutex mechanism may be used in addition to Vulkan semaphores to synchronize the work.
Keyed mutexes are a property of a properly created shareable Direct3D 11 resource.
They can only be used if the imported resource was created with the D3D11_RESOURCE_MISC_SHARED_KEYEDMUTEX flag.
To acquire keyed mutexes before submitted work and/or release them after, add a structure to .
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoKHR.N: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoKHR.A: The number of entries in <see cref="AcquireSyncs"/>, <see cref="AcquireKeys"/>, and <see cref="AcquireTimeouts"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> objects which were imported from Direct3D 11 resources.
A pointer to an array of mutex key values to wait for prior to beginning the submitted work.
Entries refer to the keyed mutex associated with the corresponding entries in <see cref="AcquireSyncs"/>.
A pointer to an array of timeout values, in millisecond units, for each acquire specified in <see cref="AcquireKeys"/>.
VkWin32KeyedMutexAcquireReleaseInfoKHR.R: The number of entries in <see cref="ReleaseSyncs"/> and <see cref="ReleaseKeys"/>.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDeviceMemory"/> objects which were imported from Direct3D 11 resources.
A pointer to an array of mutex key values to set when the submitted work has completed.
Entries refer to the keyed mutex associated with the corresponding entries in <see cref="ReleaseSyncs"/>.

VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewFeatures.summar: Structure describing multiview features that can be supported by an implementation.
VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewFeatures.Next.s: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewFeatures.Multiv: Whether the implementation supports multiview rendering within a render pass.
If this feature is not enabled, the view mask of each subpass must always be zero.
Whether the implementation supports multiview rendering within a render pass, with geometry shaders.
If this feature is not enabled, then a pipeline compiled against a subpass with a non-zero view mask must not include a geometry shader.
Whether the implementation supports multiview rendering within a render pass, with tessellation shaders.
If this feature is not enabled, then a pipeline compiled against a subpass with a non-zero view mask must not include any tessellation shaders.
VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewProperties.summ: Structure describing multiview limits that can be supported by an implementation.
VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewProperties.Next: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkPhysicalDeviceMultiviewProperties.MaxM: One greater than the maximum view index that can be used in a subpass.
The maximum valid value of instance index allowed to be generated by a drawing command recorded within a subpass of a multiview render pass instance.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.summary: Structure containing multiview information for all subpasses.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.remarks: If the VkRenderPassCreateInfo::pNext chain includes a VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo structure, then that structure includes an array of view masks, view offsets, and correlation masks for the render pass.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.Next.sum: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.SubpassC: Zero or the number of subpasses in the render pass.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.ViewMask: A pointer to an array of <see cref="SubpassCount"/> view masks, where each mask is a bitfield of view indices describing which views rendering is broadcast to in each subpass, when multiview is enabled.
If <see cref="SubpassCount"/> is zero, each view mask is treated as zero.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.Dependen: Zero or the number of dependencies in the render pass.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.ViewOffs: A pointer to an array of <see cref="DependencyCount"/> view offsets, one for each dependency.

If is zero, each dependency’s view offset is treated as zero.
Each view offset controls which views in the source subpass the views in the destination subpass depend on.
VkRenderPassMultiviewCreateInfo.Correlat: Zero or the number of correlation masks.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="CorrelationMaskCount"/> view masks indicating sets of views that may be more efficient to render concurrently.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.summary: Structure describing capabilities of a surface.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
The minimum number of images the specified device supports for a swapchain created for the surface, and will be at least one.
The maximum number of images the specified device supports for a swapchain created for the surface, and will be either 0, or greater than or equal to <see cref="MinImageCount"/>.
A value of 0 means that there is no limit on the number of images, though there may be limits related to the total amount of memory used by presentable images.
The current width and height of the surface, or the special value (0xFFFFFFFF, 0xFFFFFFFF) indicating that the surface size will be determined by the extent of a swapchain targeting the surface.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.MinImageExtent: The smallest valid swapchain extent for the surface on the specified device.

The <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of the extent will each be less than or equal to the corresponding <c>width</c> and <c>height</c> of <see cref="CurrentExtent"/>, unless <see cref="CurrentExtent"/> has the special value described above.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.MaxImageExtent: The largest valid swapchain extent for the surface on the specified device.

The width and height of the extent will each be greater than or equal to the corresponding width and height of .
The width and height of the extent will each be greater than or equal to the corresponding width and height of , unless has the special value described above.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.MaxImageArrayL: The maximum number of layers presentable images can have for a swapchain created for this device and surface, and will be at least one.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.SupportedTrans: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagBitsKHR"/> bitmask indicating the presentation transforms supported for the surface on the specified device. At least one bit will be set.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.CurrentTransfo: A <see cref="VkSurfaceTransformFlagsKHR"/> value indicating the surface’s current transform relative to the presentation engine’s natural orientation.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.SupportedCompo: A <see cref="VkCompositeAlphaFlagsKHR"/> bitmask, representing the alpha compositing modes supported by the presentation engine for the surface on the specified device, and at least one bit will be set.

Opaque composition can be achieved in any alpha compositing mode by either using an image format that has no alpha component, or by ensuring that all pixels in the presentable images have an alpha value of 1.0.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.SupportedUsage: A <see cref="VkImageUsageFlags"/> bitmask representing the ways the application can use the presentable images of a swapchain created with <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR"/> set to <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.ImmediateKhr"/>, <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.MailboxKhr"/>, <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.FifoKhr"/>, or <see cref="VkPresentModeKHR.FifoRelaxedKhr"/> for the surface on the specified device.

must be included in the set.
Implementations may support additional usages.
VkSurfaceCapabilities2EXT.SupportedSurfa: A <see cref="VkSurfaceCounterFlagsEXT"/> bitmask indicating the supported surface counter types.

VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.summary: Structure describing a single descriptor update of the descriptor update template.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.Destinat: The descriptor binding to update when using this descriptor update template.
The starting element in the array belonging to <see cref="DestinationBinding"/>.

If the descriptor binding identified by <see cref="DestinationBinding"/> has a descriptor type of <see cref="VkDescriptorType.InlineUniformBlock"/> then <see cref="DestinationArrayElement"/> specifies the starting <see langword="byte"/> offset to update.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.Descript: The number of descriptors to update.

If is greater than the number of remaining array elements in the destination binding, those affect consecutive bindings in a manner similar to above.
If the descriptor binding identified by has a descriptor type of then specifies the number of s to update and the remaining array elements in the destination binding refer to the remaining number of s in it.
A <see cref="VkDescriptorType"/> specifying the type of the descriptor.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.Offset.s: The offset in <see langword="byte"/>s of the first binding in the raw data structure.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.Stride.s: The stride in <see langword="byte"/>s between two consecutive array elements of the descriptor update information in the raw data structure.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry.Stride.r: The actual pointer ptr for each array element j of update entry i is computed using the following formula:const char *ptr = (const char *)Data + DescriptorUpdateEntries[i].Offset + j * DescriptorUpdateEntries[i].StrideThe stride is useful in case the bindings are stored in structs along with other data. If is then the value of is ignored and the stride is assumed to be 1, i.e. the descriptor update information for them is always specified as a contiguous range.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.sum: Structure specifying parameters of a newly created descriptor update template.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Nex: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Des: The number of elements in the <see cref="DescriptorUpdateEntries"/> array.
A pointer to an array of <see cref="VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateEntry"/> structures describing the descriptors to be updated by the descriptor update template.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Tem: The type of the descriptor update template.

If set to it can only be used to update descriptor sets with a fixed .
If set to it can only be used to push descriptor sets using the provided , , and set number.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Des: The descriptor set layout used to build the descriptor update template.

All descriptor sets which are going to be updated through the newly created descriptor update template must be created with a layout that matches (is the same as, or defined identically to) this layout.
This parameter is ignored if is not .
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Pip: A <see cref="VkPipelineBindPoint"/> indicating the type of the pipeline that will use the descriptors.
This parameter is ignored if <see cref="TemplateType"/> is not <see cref="VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateType.PushDescriptorsKhr"/>.
A <see cref="VkPipelineLayout"/> object used to program the bindings.
This parameter is ignored if <see cref="TemplateType"/> is not <see cref="VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateType.PushDescriptorsKhr"/>.
VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateCreateInfo.Set: The set number of the descriptor set in the pipeline layout that will be updated.
This parameter is ignored if <see cref="TemplateType"/> is not <see cref="VkDescriptorUpdateTemplateType.PushDescriptorsKhr"/>.

VkHdrMetadataEXT.DisplayPrimaryBlue.summ: A <see cref="VkXYColorEXT"/> structure specifying the reference monitor’s blue primary in chromaticity coordinates.

VkDisplayNativeHdrSurfaceCapabilitiesAMD: Structure describing display native HDR specific capabilities of a surface.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
Whether the surface supports local dimming.

If this is , can be used to explicitly enable or disable local dimming for the surface.
Local dimming may also be overridden by during the lifetime of the swapchain.
VkSwapchainDisplayNativeHdrCreateInfoAMD: Structure specifying display native HDR parameters of a newly created swapchain object.

If the <see cref="VkSwapchainCreateInfoKHR.Next"/> chain includes a <see cref="VkSwapchainDisplayNativeHdrCreateInfoAMD"/> structure, then that structure includes additional swapchain creation parameters specific to display native HDR support.
<see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
Whether local dimming is enabled for the swapchain.
VkRefreshCycleDurationGOOGLE.summary: Structure containing the RC duration of a display.
VkRefreshCycleDurationGOOGLE.RefreshDura: The number of nanoseconds from the start of one refresh cycle to the next.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.summary: Structure containing timing information about a previously-presented image.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.PresentID: An application-provided value that was given to a previous <see cref="VK.QueuePresentKHR"/> command via <see cref="VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.PresentID"/>.
It can be used to uniquely identify a previous present with the <see cref="VK.QueuePresentKHR"/> command.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.DesiredPr: An application-provided value that was given to a previous <see cref="VK.QueuePresentKHR"/> command via <see cref="VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.DesiredPresentTime"/>.
If non-zero, it was used by the application to indicate that an image not be presented any sooner than <see cref="DesiredPresentTime"/>.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.ActualPre: The time when the image of the swapchain was actually displayed.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.EarliestP: The time when the image of the swapchain could have been displayed.
This may differ from <see cref="ActualPresentTime"/> if the application requested that the image be presented no sooner than <see cref="VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.DesiredPresentTime"/>.
VkPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE.PresentMa: An indication of how early the <see cref="VK.QueuePresentKHR"/> command was processed compared to how soon it needed to be processed, and still be presented at <see cref="EarliestPresentTime"/>.
VkPresentTimesInfoGOOGLE.summary: The earliest time each image should be presented.
VkPresentTimesInfoGOOGLE.remarks:
When the extension is enabled, additional fields can be specified that allow an application to specify the earliest time that an image should be displayed.
This allows an application to avoid stutter that is caused by an image being displayed earlier than planned.
Such stuttering can occur with both fixed and variable-refresh-rate displays, because stuttering occurs when the geometry is not correctly positioned for when the image is displayed.
An application can instruct the presentation engine that an image should not be displayed earlier than a specified time by adding a structure to the chain.
VkPresentTimesInfoGOOGLE.Next.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to a structure extending this structure.
The number of swapchains being presented to by this command.
VkPresentTimesInfoGOOGLE.Times.summary: <see langword="null"/> or a pointer to an array of <see cref="VkPresentTimeGOOGLE"/> elements with <see cref="SwapchainCount"/> entries.
VkPresentTimesInfoGOOGLE.Times.remarks: If not <see langword="null"/>, each element of <see cref="Times"/> contains the earliest time to present the image corresponding to the entry in the <see cref="VkPresentInfoKHR.ImageIndices"/> array.
VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.summary: The earliest time image should be presented.
VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.PresentID.summary: An application-provided identification value, that can be used with the results of <see cref="VK.GetPastPresentationTimingGOOGLE"/>, in order to uniquely identify this present.
VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.PresentID.remarks: In order to be useful to the application, it should be unique within some period of time that is meaningful to the application.
VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.DesiredPresentTime.s: Specifies that the image given should not be displayed to the user any earlier than this time.
VkPresentTimeGOOGLE.DesiredPresentTime.r:
is a time in nanoseconds, relative to a monotonically-increasing clock (e.g. CLOCK_MONOTONIC (see clock_gettime(2)) on Android and Linux).
A value of zero specifies that the presentation engine may display the image at any time.
This is useful when the application desires to provide .
